"Wow, this establishment appears to be quite extensive in its layout, with numerous sections and areas that seem to stretch out endlessly, almost like a labyrinthine maze designed to tantalize and confound one's senses. It's truly impressive, and I must admit that I haven't had the pleasure of exploring every nook and cranny of this vast space, despite my best efforts to do so. There are multiple levels, each boasting its own unique charm and allure, with upstairs rooms that offer an air of exclusivity and privacy for those seeking a more intimate experience. The staff here is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and while some might attribute their warm demeanor to my gender, I would argue that it's simply a result of their inherent kindness and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Indeed, the performers themselves exude an aura of warmth and approachability, making them feel less like'strippers' and more like gracious hosts who just happen to possess a certain je ne sais quoi that sets them apart from the average individual. They are, in short, a true delight to behold, and their pleasant scent only serves to enhance the overall ambiance of the club."

"I recently indulged in a two-night stay at the luxurious Aria hotel, courtesy of my company's generosity, which I must say, was greatly appreciated since the accommodation rates are rather exorbitant, and I wouldn't necessarily categorize it as an affordable indulgence. Furthermore, the beverages served at the pool area are quite costly, with one particular drink commanding a premium price that I am unable to disclose here, but rest assured, it's reputed to be among the priciest on the Las Vegas Strip. Despite not receiving the complimentary chocolates or turn-down service that some previous guests have reported, our stay was generally enjoyable. However, I must admit that the bathroom amenities left much to be desired, specifically the lower-end brand and quality of the products. The dining establishments within the hotel, particularly the Thai restaurant, impressed us with their exceptional culinary offerings, rivaling those of its stateside counterparts. The casino itself was well-maintained, relatively smoke-free, and the servers demonstrated impressive efficiency. The pool area offered several appealing options, including an adults-only section, ensuring a peaceful and relaxing experience without the presence of boisterous children. While I would have preferred more shaded areas or umbrellas, the overall pool experience was satisfactory. In conclusion, Aria undoubtedly offers a superb lodging experience, albeit at a premium price point, which is unsurprising given its reputation for excellence."

"As one of the contemporary establishments situated along the famed Las Vegas Strip, this hotel boasts a sleek, modernistic motif that permeates its entirety. 

PROS -
+ An atmosphere of tranquility and refinement pervades the resort, fostering a sense of relaxation and serenity for its patrons. 
+ Immaculately maintained facilities, including a pristine swimming pool, spotless guest rooms, and immaculate corridors, contribute to an overall ambiance of elegance. 
+ The accommodations themselves are equipped with a host of cutting-edge amenities, such as an electric mini-stove, refrigerator, microwave, dining table, supremely comfortable bed, et cetera, all of which serve to enhance the overall experience of the guests. 
+ The hospitality of the staff is unparalleled, as they exude warmth, cordiality, and a genuine desire to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of their clientele. 


CONS -
- This particular lodging may not be the optimal choice for individuals celebrating a significant milestone, such as a 21st birthday, with a group of friends, as the atmosphere may not align with the anticipated level of revelry and joviality associated with such an occasion. (IE - minimalist attire, alcoholic beverages, and unsteady gait may elicit disapproving glances from other guests.)"

food wise it would be a 2.5 - 3 at the most, but the place and the coffee made it up for the 4th star.

Let me start with the food. If you've never eaten authentic Spanish dishes, you'll be pleased. Otherwise you'll be disappointed. 

The olives were good. 

The shrimp dish (gambas al pil pil) was also decent.

The traditional paella was good but more a risotto than a paella. Too creamy, different kind of rice (at least the texture is different) but the saffron hint and the chorizo were tasteful.

The tortilla was ok. A little burn and dry but pretty decent.

The wine selection is limited and most of the wines are NOT Spanish, AYFKM? They had one Rivera del Duero and one Rioja. Come on, you have a Spanish themed place and no Spanish wine?

Now the coffee. I tried the cold brew and the kopi luwak. Both pretty good. The coffee paraphernalia is also worth the visit! If you are caffeine sensitive, this might not be for you.

I didn't check if in the menu they include "cafe bombon", a Spanish classic. I'll go back to verify that and if not, at least to get good coffee!

Cheers

Whenever I reflect upon Richardson's, a profound sense of warmth and comfort permeates my being. Having had the pleasure of partaking in numerous culinary excursions within its walls, I can confidently attest to the captivating ambiance that pervades this quaint, inconspicuous urban gem.

The 'Cuisine of New Mexico', characterized by a distinctive fusion of flavors and ingredients, boasts an unparalleled uniqueness; among their renowned offerings, the green chile potato and an array of pork dishes hold pride of place. As a pescatarian, I tend to gravitate towards the fish or seafood specials, which are artfully presented alongside a thoughtfully curated standard menu, complemented by an assortment of daily specials inscribed on chalkboards dispersed throughout the restaurant.

During my most recent visit, I relished the blackened scallop appetizer as my entre, accompanied by a generous house salad. While the scallops exhibited a slight saltiness, their texture was cooked to perfection, and they were served atop a crispy tortilla, accompanied by a medley of rice, beans, and a spicy sauce that added a delightful zest to the dish. The salads, in particular, prove to be a highlight, with many of the entre specials thoughtfully paired with a starter salad. In the company of four fellow diners, we opted to share a bottle of wine and a plain pizza as an appetizer, rendering dessert an afterthought, as none of us could muster the requisite capacity to indulge in anything further.

To avoid any unnecessary waiting, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance. However, should you find yourself waiting, take advantage of the opportunity to situate yourself at the bar or near the fireplace; with a refreshing beverage in hand and surrounded by the warm, inviting aroma of the fire mingling with the savory scents of the kitchen, any perceived delay quickly dissipates amidst the convivial atmosphere. My affection for Richardson's remains steadfast, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit.

If you're not looking for this place, you just might miss it. It's tucked away in a strip mall and worth the hunt. I went with Elite Emily as we explored Henderson more, and we were practically the only people in the spot. The orders were HUGE. It takes a lot for me to wave the white flag, but I had to ask for a box. All the food is fresh and pretty dern tasty. There's really nothing you can go wrong with here, so I'm looking forward to my next trip to try something else!

"The young male individual, who typically does not derive pleasure from visiting institutions dedicated to the preservation and exhibition of artistic, cultural, or scientific artifacts, experienced an unusual sense of enjoyment during his visit to this particular establishment, which boasted an extensive collection of historically significant and provocative sexual instruments, as well as various multimedia presentations, live demonstrations, and an array of captivating objects that catered to diverse interests and preferences associated with human sexuality, thereby offering a comprehensive and engaging exploration of the subject matter, further enhanced by the presence of knowledgeable and unobtrusive staff members, who contributed to a welcoming atmosphere that encouraged repeat visits."

I arrived at this esteemed establishment on a Sunday, thereby obviating the necessity for a prior reservation. And let me tell you, this place truly is the apogee of culinary excellence, exuding an ambiance that is at once both convivial and sophisticated. The olfactory sensations that permeate the air are nothing short of captivating, while the visually appealing decor and well-appointed furnishings lend an air of elegance to the proceedings. The waiting staff, too, are deserving of commendation, their proficiency and hospitality being of the highest order. Upon divulging my dietary restrictions, the chef de cuisine himself kindly took the time to expound upon the various dishes that were already suitable for a vegan palate, in addition to those that could be easily adapted to meet my requirements. It transpired that a considerable number of sauces employed in the culinary process contained fish or oyster sauce, a fact that had hitherto escaped my notice. Suffice it to say that I wholeheartedly endorse this restaurant, and eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall most certainly indulge in the delectable green curry accompanied by tofu - a veritable gustatory delight, I have no doubt.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that each visit has been a truly gratifying experience. Most recently, I had the privilege of dining here in the company of some visiting family and friends, and suffice it to say that everyone in attendance left feeling thoroughly satiated. 
  For those seeking uniquely crafted, expertly mixed beverages, this venue is an absolute must-visit destination. The drinks menu boasts an impressive array of libations, each one thoughtfully categorized by historical era and accompanied by a brief description elucidating the origins of its name. 
  During our visit, nearly all members of our party opted to take advantage of the happy hour special, which featured steaks at half price. While one of the filets was unfortunately slightly undercooked, the remainder of the dishes were cooked to perfection. Furthermore, the assortment of side dishes we ordered were, without exception, utterly delectable, with the truffle macaroni and cheese emerging as a clear favorite among our group. I would be remiss if I did not give special mention to the "Farmer" flatbread pizza, whose ingredients included bacon, spinach, and a perfectly cooked egg; this dish is nothing short of a gastronomic masterpiece, and I implore you to sample it for yourself in order to fully appreciate its splendor. 
  As for dessert, while we initially harbored doubts about our ability to consume anything further, our server's vivid descriptions quickly dispelled such concerns. We opted to try both the pizooki (a delightful, crispy flatbread confection) and the homemade doughnuts, and I am pleased to report that both offerings met and indeed surpassed our loftiest expectations. The word "heavenly" does not even begin to do justice to the sublime experience that these desserts provided. In conclusion, I must reiterate my unwavering endorsement of this superlative eatery, whose ambiance, culinary prowess, and expertly crafted potions make it a true gem, tucked away from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip.
Nice, big patio to enjoy a conversation and catch up with friends. The inside was clean and service was nice. All the pastries looked especially tasty at this location. Nice job.

During a sweltering spring day in Chinatown, I experienced an unrelenting sensation of hunger, which is not unusual given my accelerated metabolic rate. Having grown weary of my customary Thai cuisine, I opted to explore novel gastronomical options and discovered HSP through a cursory examination of Yelp.

Upon arriving at the establishment, located towards the conclusion of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Road and Spring Mountain, I encountered a hospitable female staff member who divulged that the restaurant had been in operation for five years, news that left me feeling utterly oblivious to my surroundings, much like a marine creature dwelling at the bottom of a pineapple.

My voracious appetite compelled me to advance toward the eatery, whereupon I beheld a modest storefront presenting a limited assortment of diverse poke varieties. The diminutive quantity of each poke served as a testament to the proprietors' commitment to preserving the freshness of their seafood offerings. As an individual without any significant experience with Hawaiian cuisine or coastal residency, I could still discern the absence of fishy odors in my Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl, substantiating my supposition that the poke was indeed fresh. This delightful culinary discovery, complemented by warm rice embellished with black sesame seeds and available at a mere $8, kindled within me an eagerness to revisit the establishment and sample additional menu items.

My 10 year old boys had fun.  A little pricey but it is clean, well lit and not too loud.  For the adults....the wifi blows, the food is not very good and expensive.  A small iced latte was just under $5.  Can't bring anything in either....(and Pepsi products..ick).\n\nAll attractions/games were in good working condition.

I have been frequenting this establishment since the middle of the 1980s, and I must say that it has maintained a remarkable level of consistency throughout the years. At first glance, this may appear to be a humble, unassuming curry house, devoid of any pretenses of refined dining. However, upon closer inspection, one will discover that it offers an array of delectable and reasonably priced culinary options, accompanied by an attentive and hospitable service staff. On a cold winter's evening, as the biting winds whip through Bruntsfield Place, there is little more comforting than forcing one's way through the double doors and into the welcoming warmth and enticing aroma of exotic Indian spices that permeate the atmosphere within. A word of caution, however, regarding the naan bread: it is only available in massive, generous portions, suitable for feeding a small army, so be prepared to share or risk facing the consequences of overindulgence.

"It is imperative that I deduct a star due to the prolonged waiting period for the outdoor seating area, despite our repeated visits to this establishment, which has led me to infer that the patio does not accept reservations. A delay of one and a half hours at 5:30 PM is somewhat absurd, considering the reputation of this restaurant. However, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings are consistently exceptional, with my personal preference being a succulent steak, while my spouse favors either the skate or a hearty portion of slow-cooked short ribs. It is also worth mentioning that we have never encountered an unpleasant server or subpar dish during our visits. In conclusion, if you wish to partake in the ambiance of the patio, which offers unparalleled people-watching opportunities, it is advisable to anticipate a delay. Unfortunately, the current system in place does not allow for timely notification via text message when a table becomes available, which can be inconvenient given the limited range of the sensors within the casino. Nonetheless, the quality of the cuisine makes the wait worthwhile."

"Prior to this experience, my exposure to live performances had been limited, with neither a Cirque de Soleil production nor any other theatrical presentation in Las Vegas having been part of my repertoire. Consequently, my attendance at this particular show served as an inaugural encounter of its kind for me, which, to my delight, transpired to be a thoroughly captivating and enjoyable affair. The musicians' virtuosity was undeniably evident throughout the performance, while the dancers' vivacity and dynamism infused the production with an unmistakable vitality. Moreover, the acrobats' displays of physical prowess and artistry left me in a state of utter amazement. It is worth mentioning that our admission to the event was complimentary, which, needless to say, contributed significantly to the overall satisfaction we derived from the experience."

We placed an order for the delectable lobster and shrimp dip, but unfortunately, we were compelled to return it on two separate occasions due to an excessive amount of cheese, which rendered the dish unpleasantly rich and overpowering. The texture of the chips was compromised by the copious amount of cheese, causing them to break apart easily when submerged in the accompanying sauce. Consequently, the establishment graciously decided to remove the item from our bill. Subsequent to this, we opted to sample the parmesan chicken and baked potato, which proved to be a satisfying culinary experience, sufficient for two individuals to share.
Great find!  Visiting from DC and loved the unique take on menu!  Witty and original.  The food was excellent! Can't say enough about the pierogi sliders and the eggplant lasagna!!

This is  a great little deli with a large menu.  Breakfast is available, fried eggs, potatoes etc. that is unusual for a place like this.  Not sure it is all that authentic but they have hot pastrami and corned beef.  Product seems to be above average but what really made me decide to make a return trip was the service.  Very friendly and helpful.   Seems to be a popular place.

My spouse and I indulged in an evening of artistic exploration, characterized by an unparalleled level of enjoyment, under the guidance of an individual named Melissa, whose vivacity and warmth permeated the atmosphere, albeit with a slight lack of clarity in her explanations, yet compensating for this deficiency by affording us ample time to execute each stage of the creative process. An exemplary work of art, suspended from the ceiling, served as a point of reference, allowing us to appreciate its beauty and complexity. Beverages, priced at five dollars for a glass of beer and seven dollars for a glass of wine, were available for purchase, with the added bonus of a fifty percent discount during the final hour of the session. As we had satiated our hunger prior to attending, I did not have the opportunity to sample the culinary offerings, although it appeared that many participants availed themselves of the brief respite afforded during the middle of the class to partake of various hors d'oeuvres. This unique experience, which I wholeheartedly endorse, is certain to be repeated in the future, and I would enthusiastically recommend it to any individual seeking an engaging and distinctive diversion.
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of an exceptionally high quality, boasting an authenticity that is unparalleled in its genre. The piquant flavors, as suggested by the moniker, are truly palpable and evoke a profound sense of satisfaction. So much so, that we felt compelled to partake in their delectable fare on two separate occasions during our brief sojourn in Las Vegas, and both experiences left us feeling utterly content."

It is indeed high time that Summerlin boasts a respectable public house, bar, or tavernwhatever nomenclature one might opt forand it is gratifying to observe that such an establishment has finally been instituted. The personnel at this venue are remarkably hospitable, exhibiting an attentive demeanor without being excessively intrusive. The culinary offerings are quite delectable, particularly the chicken sandwich, which constitutes a veritable explosion of flavors. The waitstaff has divulged that patrons can request the chicken sandwich to be served as a wrap, an option that is not explicitly listed on the menu. This revelation precipitates our profound gratitude.

However, there are certain aspects that warrant mentioning. Firstly, for those who partake in the practice of checking in on review websites, it is worth noting that doing so will reward them with a complimentary shot of the establishment's signature whiskey. Unfortunately, this particular elixir is not especially palatable, bearing a strong resemblance to a medicinal concoction such as Triaminic cold and cough medicine. Thus, it is advisable to exercise caution when indulging in this particular promotion.

Furthermore, the design of the bathroom sinks leaves much to be desired. The decision to implement a slightly tilted slab of tile as a sink is, quite frankly, baffling. Such a configuration not only hinders the effective containment of water but also generates an unfortunate propensity for splashing, thereby endangering the integrity of one's attire. It is our fervent hope that management will consider replacing these questionable sink designs with more traditional basins, thereby ensuring a more pleasant experience for all patrons.

In conclusion, this establishment offers ample space for socializing, a convivial atmosphere, and delectable victuals. While certain aspects may benefit from revision, the overall quality of this pub/bar/hang-out/tavern remains undeniable.

Been here three times now and will keep coming back. One of the best buffet values for locals and with coupons a good value for visitors.
The prime rib is perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they are happy to give it to you. The crab legs are fresh every time I have been there and they have several types of shrimp. Something for every seafood lover.
The Mexican food could use a little work, the enchiladas have been hard but they have lots of Asian choices and the American part of the buffet has always been delicious.
And the deserts? Oh yeah! lots of choices with plenty of no sugar added ones for those who need it.
The servers are not only professional but personal.

"This quaint, family-operated eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable bagels, complemented by exceptional customer service. The extensive breakfast and lunch menus cater to diverse palates, and the accommodating kitchen staff readily fulfills special dietary requests with alacrity."

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

Great wine and bruschetta, especially the apple one. Good live music when I went. They need a fire pit outside though! There is not much out there and they need to liven it up some. But great wine bar

They consistently demonstrate a profound commitment to the well-being and development of my children, devoting considerable time and effort toward fostering their growth and understanding. It is not uncommon for them to maintain a waiting list, such is the high demand for their services, and it is advisable to schedule an appointment in advance to ensure availability. However, any inconvenience this may cause is more than compensated for by the tangible improvements that become apparent in my children's behavior and performance, which serve as a testament to the exceptional quality of their work.

"My sentiments regarding this pizza are ones of profound admiration, specifically pertaining to the judicious blend of mozzarella and provolone cheese, wherein the latter is incorporated in a manner that enhances, rather than overpowers, the former, thereby creating a culinary experience that is truly exceptional; additionally, the service we received was of an impressively high quality, such that it served to further elevate our dining experience; it is worth noting, however, that my previous experiences at this establishment have been somewhat inconsistent, with periods of disappointment interspersed among moments of satisfaction, but on this particular occasion, they demonstrated a commendable level of competence and dedication to their craft."

"An exceptional equestrian facility ideal for family outings, offering a seamless and efficient experience from initial reservation to conclusion, boasting a picturesque desert setting in North Scottsdale particularly breathtaking during the spring season, complemented by well-manicured grounds conducive to a leisurely horseback ride, further enhanced by a team of accommodating, polite, and knowledgeable staff members who guarantee a memorable visit, leaving a lasting impression that warrants future visits without hesitation."

I was utterly thrilled to have the chance to experience the exhilaration of a roller coaster ride within the confines of a casino/hotel, despite the fact that I am perhaps approaching an age where such activities may be deemed unsuitable and, furthermore, have been known to cause a considerable amount of discomfort; however, I firmly believe that one is only young once and should seize every opportunity to indulge in youthful pursuits. The queues to purchase tickets were somewhat inefficient, which I attribute to the sudden influx of patrons eager to partake in the attraction before its closure at midnight on weekends.

The ride itself was simultaneously terrifying and humorous, as I failed to carefully consider my attire and my companion and I couldn't help but burst into fits of laughter upon viewing our photographs. The cost of each picture was $15, with the option to purchase two for $22, which we opted for and split the cost. The employee assisting us gave me a look of utter incredulity when I requested that he charge two separate cards, leading me to wonder if he truly understood the concept of customer satisfaction and the importance of fostering a positive experience for patrons. Nonetheless, this minor inconvenience did not detract from the overall enjoyment of the ride.

"Despite its unfavorable geographical positioning, Whiskey Dicks revels in its capacity to proffer an enjoyable drinking experience, courtesy of its impressive array of artfully-crafted brews and hospitable staff. Upon entering the establishment, we were warmly received by a congenial hostess clad in abbreviated attire, who expedited our seating process with alacrity. I opted for a Ranger IPA from their diverse selection of tap beverages, which, in my opinion, constitutes a commendable choice. The assortment of beers available at this everyday drinkery is indeed satisfactory. My culinary excursion began with an order of philly cheese accompanied by mesquite seasoned fries. The latter proved to be a gastronomic highlight, as the flavorful seasoning augmented the inherent deliciousness of the potatoes. However, the philly itself was not without its flaws, as the steak exhibited a tendency towards dryness and an excess of bread hindered the overall enjoyment of the dish. Nonetheless, the freshness of the onions and peppers provided a welcome contrast. Considering the aforementioned factors, I chose to elevate Whiskey Dicks by a star in my rating, primarily due to the establishment's commitment to offering a variety of palatable craft beers alongside its hospitable atmosphere. Although alternative pubs within close proximity may boast superior offerings, Whiskey Dicks' collection of New Belgian beers and Sam Adams seasonal brews renders it a worthy destination for those seeking a satisfying drinking experience."

Have eaten here many a time.  I used to get it delivered at my old job, and then recently was lucky enough to work only 1 block away.  Would visit once a week or so and get the Chicken Pita.  A great flavored grilled chicken, I ordered it with the whole wheat pita.  Topped with some cucumber sauce and hot garlic chili sauce makes it perfect.\n\nWould highly recommend it!  Reasonably priced at $8 for a whole pita.

"Having had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, I must say that I have developed a profound fondness for it! The staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional friendliness and promptness, earning an A+ rating in my book. The ambiance, reminiscent of a Toby Keith's Jr., scores a respectable B+. The entertainment, in the form of live music, has been nothing short of spectacular, warranting an A+ grade. While the bar boasts an impressive selection, lacking only Norm, it still merits an A rating. Prices are average, but the food, with the exception of the steak, has been somewhat underwhelming, garnering a B score; however, the burgers and fries are highly recommended. In conclusion, taking into account the welcoming atmosphere, excellent staff, and top-notch entertainment, I award this establishment a solid A. I strongly advise paying a visit to this venue, as you are certain to appreciate the warmth and hospitality of the people and the surroundings. We eagerly anticipate our next visit, during which we undoubtedly will savor their delectable burgers."

I came here first time with an educated shooter that already had guns i could use. This was my second time ever shooting but first at a range. They sold us the bullets and targets gave us protective geer and off we went to an enclosed room to shoot very simple short breefing. Place is nicely set up central location, staff was nice. The other two people went to get certified not the paper test but shooting test i decided i needed more time to practice. The only thing i really did not like was how many tourist were there. I really hope they open another location more for locals. The prices are to high because its geared toward tourism. I like the fact classes are free though. I went on a monday around 9am not to busy but as the day progressed the place got packed so go during the week early otherwise you will be waiting. I will be back to practice more and test taking but i think im going to save some money and look for a cheaper place for bullets and targets.

"The gastronomical experience at this establishment is utterly remarkable. Drawing comparisons with other eateries under the same culinary umbrella, the fare presented here surpasses expectations, boasting an extensive array of delectable options that cater to diverse tastes. However, it is pertinent to note that the quality of service does not complement the exquisite cuisine, as it is often characterized by a sluggish pace, forgetfulness, and other shortcomings. Furthermore, the portion sizes are relatively diminutive, which may prove disappointing for patrons who crave more substantial helpings. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, we had the privilege of securing a table without delay on a Saturday evening, affording us the luxury of choosing between indoor or outdoor seating, thus suggesting that the wait time may be inconsistent."

"Vietnamese Sandwiches: A culinary delight that warrants a visit to this establishment, in my humble opinion. The pice de rsistance of their menu, these delectable sandwiches boast a freshly baked bread that delicately balances a satisfying crunch and warmth, courtesy of Hue Thai's diligent preparation. My gastronomical exploits have led me to conclude that this eatery reigns supreme in the realm of Vietnamese sandwiches within Las Vegas.  

Other menu items: Although they offer an array of Vietnamese, Chinese, and Thai cuisine, the authenticity of these dishes leaves much to be desired. However, their Vietnamese sandwiches and boba tea (which is passable) are the exceptions that prove the rule. Unfortunately, their pho falls short of my expectations. 

Price: A veritable steal! These scrumptious sandwiches can be had for the paltry sum of $3.50 apiece. However, be aware that a minimum purchase of $20 is required for the privilege of using a debit card, a caveat that may prove vexing for those who, like myself, eschew carrying cash. 

Ambiance: While dining at this establishment may not be the most aesthetically pleasing experience, owing to the curious combination of cleaning product and food odors and the rather jarring decorative scheme, it is by no means unpleasant. In fact, the design, which appears to be inspired by an underwater theme, adds a touch of whimsy to the proceedings. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying and affordable meal. Rating: 4/5 stars."

"Although the barbecue did possess a certain degree of culinary merit, it failed to surpass the threshold of excellence, falling short of the lofty expectations we had fostered. However, it must be acknowledged that the assortment of barbecue sauces available did exhibit a commendable diversity, catering to the diverse preferences of patrons. Furthermore, the gratuitous offering of kettle chips served as a welcome gesture, contributing to an atmosphere of unpretentious hospitality. It is worth mentioning that the speed at which our order was fulfilled and delivered to our table did border on the extraordinary, a testament to the establishment's proficiency in expediting orders with alacrity."

"Remarkable! The culinary delight that was the Farm burger, coupled with the delectable sweet potato fries sprinkled with powdered sugar, was truly a gastronomical experience worthy of acclaim. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of service did not live up to the high standards set by the exquisite fare, as we encountered an inexplicable delay in receiving our fries, which ultimately arrived only after we had nearly completed our burgers."

I have been a loyal patron of this establishment for in excess of a decade, and despite my occasional forays into alternative venues, I invariably find myself returning to Nancy's salon, primarily due to the warm and welcoming ambiance, but also because of the exceptional quality of their nail care services and pedicures, which have consistently met, and indeed surpassed, my expectations.

This establishment offers an exceptional experience, as evidenced by the abundance of items I acquired for my son upon his birth, primarily consisting of gently used articles of clothing from my husband's extensive family and several of my close acquaintances, which rendered it impossible for him to don them all, even if I altered his attire five times daily. Consequently, I undertook a quest to locate a reputable consignment venue where I could procure novel apparel for him as he developed. Fortunately, numerous such establishments exist in my vicinity (specifically, central Phoenix), and after visiting two other locations prior to arriving at Smarty Pants (with the caveat being not to frequent Urban Baby, as it proved unsatisfactory), I encountered a warm and hospitable reception from the mother-daughter ownership duo. They accepted the majority of the items I presented and, despite my initial intention to merely deposit my goods, I found myself indulging in a shopping spree, resulting in the acquisition of three superior tops for a mere $15 in total. The shop boasted an incredible inventory, maintained a spotless environment, and offered amiable service, thereby rendering it a veritable haven for customers. Additionally, I learned of their impending expansion into the adjacent space, destined to accommodate furniture, while the current location would feature an increased selection of adult attire (although, it's possible that the new space would be designated for clothing, with the existing one being upgraded to accommodate more adult fashion). Consequently, I shall return shortly to invest my consignment funds. My gratitude extends to Smarty Pants.

After perusing Paul's review, I felt compelled to contribute my own thoughts on this exceptional performance space. The meticulous design of the venue, coupled with its impressive acoustic properties, creates an ambiance that seamlessly blends the appeal of outdoor concerts with the intimate atmosphere of a club. However, it must be noted that the alcoholic beverage options available at the amphitheater come with a hefty price tag, necessitating either a substantial financial investment or a clandestine flask for those desiring to partake in libations. Despite this drawback, the Music Factory complex presents an ideal setting for a pre-show tailgating experience reminiscent of high school revelries, albeit with a more refined selection of beverages. Notwithstanding the steep cost of drinks, this venue boasts an impressive track record of hosting diverse and eclectic performances, making it a valuable addition to the local music scene.

This establishment boasted such favorable critiques on Yelp that we traversed a considerable distance from Scottsdale during our vacation to experience the ambiance of this venue in Tempe. Our excursion proved to be worthwhile, as we were greeted by a courteous doorman who requested my identification, cognizant of my advanced age, and pronounced my name accurately while extending his well wishes for an enjoyable sojourn. The attentive bartenders periodically inquired about our welfare, ensuring that we savored every moment of our visit. Although I do not partake in beer consumption, my companion sampled their trio of brews and expressed immense satisfaction with each selection. The atmosphere of this eatery exuded a convivial, relaxed, and sporty vibe, complemented by delectable pub fare.

I conducted a cursory observation of the surrounding area while driving and noticed a vacant commercial space with an absence of any visible signage or notification. Further investigation revealed that the establishment had relocated to a nearby location, in close proximity to other home furnishing retailers such as At Home, Creative Leather, and Spencer's Appliance, at 2711 S. San Tan Village Parkway, Gilbert. The newly-established store boasts increased illumination and expansive floor-to-ceiling windows on two sides, providing an optimal atmosphere for customers to peruse their offerings.

"As I previously mentioned in my initial posting regarding Princess Nails, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, bordering on squalor, and can aptly be described as a veritable hole in the wall. However, allow me to reiterate that Michelle, the individual responsible for administering the eyebrow waxing treatment, is truly exceptional. My second visit proved to be just as satisfying as the initial encounter. It is imperative that you request her services explicitly. While I refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating due to the establishment's conspicuous lack of cleanliness, I cannot help but wonder how they would fare without Michelle's expertise. It is essential to note that my assessment is founded solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing and does not take into account any other services offered at this location, such as nail care, which I have never availed myself of and have no intention of doing so in the future."

The initial perception of the hotel's age might deter one from considering its culinary offerings, particularly the buffet, as a primary attraction. However, our unplanned visit led to a gratifying experience, as the quality of the food, despite a limited selection, proved to be satisfactory. The pleasant surprise we encountered has kindled our inclination to revisit the establishment in the future.

After indulging in a succession of summer seasons within the confines of Phoenix, one becomes adept at identifying and cherishing specific aquatic establishments, whereupon the date shake at Sphinx transpires as an unparalleled delight, proffering a refreshing respite from the arid, sweltering ambiance that permeates the prolonged afternoons characteristic of this region, thereby catering to the needs of thirsty denizens who seek solace from the oppressive heat through the consumption of a revitalizing beverage, which has become an integral component of the local culture, boasting a rich heritage that spans multiple decades and continues to quench the thirst of Scottsdale's inhabitants to this day.

We have been eagerly anticipating the inauguration of this novel eatery for an extended period of time, and our patience has finally been rewarded. Upon partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment on the second evening of its operation, we were thoroughly delighted by the exceptional quality of the service, complementary chips and salsa, delectable fare, and refreshing beverages proffered. The meticulous renovation of the interior space has resulted in a visually stunning ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience. It is gratifying to have another superior dining option in the vicinity, which serves as a harmonious addition to the existing array of distinguished Mexican restaurants in the area.

Jimmy John's has finally established a presence in our vicinity, and we were eager to sample their offerings, having been regaled with tales of their exceptional quality and generous portions. We opted to try a pair of their signature sandwiches, specifically the No 9 Italian Night Club, showcasing the culinary marriage of salami, capicola, ham, provolone, and vegetables atop a crispy French roll, as well as the No 12 Beach Club, boasting an equally impressive array of turkey breast, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise on thick sliced 7-grain bread. Our initial impression was one of unwavering satisfaction, as the quality of the ingredients and the bread utilized in both sandwiches was undeniably superior. Furthermore, we found the pricing to be highly competitive, making Jimmy John's an attractive option for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. However, our dining experience was slightly marred by the ambient noise, which seemed to reverberate within the confines of the establishment due to its abundance of hard surfaces and lively musical selections. Notwithstanding, we remain optimistic that this issue will be addressed in the future, as the location is still in its infancy and such growing pains are customarily ironed out with time.

Funny thing is, we went to a burger place at Mandalay first. But they didn't come to our table for 5 minutes to even say hello. And 5 minutes is longer than you think when you just spent 90 minutes at the MJ One show and you're ready to eat off your hand with hunger. So we left. And came here. A bit different, to put it mildly. Service was impeccable, but not snooty. The Missus and I both got different tasting menus. Mine was the Alain Ducasse 4 course one sans wine. From the cold broccoli soup amuse to the amazing lobster curry to the foie gras topped filet to the Armagnac dessert, almost everything was very well presented and tasted amazing. First time with foie gras. Would definitely have been beyond the pale if served solo, but topping the perfectly cooked medium rare filet balanced it's richness. All I know is the junk was tasty. The only misstep was the mashed potatoes that accompanied  the filet. They were served in a bowl separate from the plate, and surprisingly...basic.  \n\nAtmosphere was romantic, view was stunning, of course, and definitely an experience to remember. Not cheap. But actually worth it.

Un super bon petit caf\u00e9, super bien situ\u00e9 pour un boost en plein milieu d'une bonne session de magasinage. Il est un peu difficile \u00e0 trouver, mais si vous prenez le passage entre le Centre Eaton et Place Ville-Marie, vous y serez. C'est plut\u00f4t un comptoir qu'un caf\u00e9 car il n'y a pas de place pour s'asseoir et siroter son latte tranquillement. Par contre, m\u00eame si votre commande ne prendra pas plus que 5-10 minutes, et donne l'impression que c'est de style \"fast food\" vu l'emplacement, vous aurez quand m\u00eame un service \u00e0 la client\u00e8le assez exceptionnel!

HUGE PORTIONS! 

Came here for lunch with my employers while I was attending a Seminar at the Hilton which is close-by. We came in and was seated promptly. Our waitress always had a smile and was quite the busy bee going from table to table. Impressive. 

I ordered a cheeseburger with fries. Markus and Miyoko ordered salads. When the salads came.. it really looked like 3 salads combined into one serving. Miyoko ordered the steak and mushroom salad that looked tasty.. Markus's salad was the same size but had an array of fruit on it. All of us were shocked of how big the portions were. I ordered my cheeseburger well done.. but it came back a bit burnt. I still ate it, but was a bit sad that it had been charred. 

All in all a good place to grab food. Especially since I heard the Riviera had crappy food joints to eat at. Would I eat here again? Only if I were in the general vicinity of the area. Its good to be back home in SF.

Following an excruciatingly monotonous experience at PURE, we meandered our way, with somewhat inebriated gaits, towards Poetry, whereupon the sonic ambiance of hip hop served as a refreshing respite from the tedium that had preceded it. Our initial visit transpired on a Thursday evening, or rather, in the early hours of Friday morning, specifically at 1:30 a.m., and we were able to gain entry without any financial obligation, thanks to certain...let's say, "diplomatic efforts." Ladies, it must be noted, were charged a nominal fee of $20, but this did not deter us from partaking in an evening replete with unadulterated jollity and merriment. The tempo of the drinks service was quite brisk, and everyone appeared to have an exceptional time, with the hip hop melodies serving as the perfect accompaniment to our revelry. It is unequivocally evident that Poetry is the optimal destination for anyone harboring an affinity for hip hop music, and we shall most certainly be revisiting this establishment on future occasions, as its ambiance and entertainment have secured an indelible place in our hearts. In fact, we returned the following night, and the enjoyment we experienced was equally as exhilarating! Thus, it is safe to assert that Poetry has become a staple of our Las Vegas itinerary.

"Gastronomical indulgences in the form of Fish and Chips, accompanied by a delectable quesadilla, were the culinary choices I opted for during the previous evening's dining excursion. Although the gustatory experience was undoubtedly pleasurable, I must confess that the aftermath has left me feeling somewhat lethargic and sluggish at present. Notwithstanding this, the eatery's ambiance was thoroughly enjoyable, boasting a spotless and well-maintained interior, complemented by the friendly and attentive service of our waitress. Furthermore, the establishment's decision to host a quiz or trivia night contributed to a convivial atmosphere, which rendered the overall mood quite mellow. As for the tap beers, they appeared to be a standard selection typically found in public houses, but I shall reserve judgment until my next visit, when I intend to partake in a nightcap and savor the full range of their beverages. Suffice it to say, my initial impression of the venue has been favorable enough to warrant a return visit, especially given its proximity to my domicile."
I had the smoked salmon on a egg white omelet.  Staff nice, ambiance fantastic, easy parking, prices comparable to downtown Scottsdale.  My drink was kinda week, but I would return for sure.

My review will strictly be on what I ordered:

White Pizza - Fantastic and straight to the point.  Cheesy without being overwhelming and heavy.  1 slice is all you really need to reach contentment unless you're someone with an over-sized appetite.  Pizza is always coming out fresh.  Huge globs of ricotta, total score.  I prefer my white pizzas a little on the creamier side, but this was good enough.  Can't complaint about a $5 slice if you're in Vegas.  Great for late night eats especially if you're staying at the hotel.

OVERALL:  Great people, love the man behind the counter.  Quick service as well.

Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Summer's proficiency in haircutting and her exceptional customer service skills rendered an unforgettably satisfactory encounter, which left me reluctant to entrust my tresses to any other stylist. Her meticulous approach and commitment to catering to my preferences were evident throughout the process, ensuring a look that not only surpassed my expectations but also fostered a sense of loyalty towards her services. Such a remarkable experience has secured her a permanent client in me, and I shall unhesitatingly return to her expertise in the future.

This is my second visit to Victoria and was for a Yelp event so obviously the atmosphere was great, but you could tell from the attitude of the bar staff that this is a great place to visit when there isn't a nice organised event (Thanks Jody B)

The mulled cider is really something you should try with options of either Lingonberry or Pear - the former is my favourite and reminds me of visits to a certain Swedish furniture store where they serve meatballs. Victoria's is, of course, part of the group of Swedish themed bars around Edinburgh including Hemma, Sofi's and Joseph Pearce which is where the link becomes pertinent.

Will definitely use this bar in the future as a meeting place when I'm around Leith Walk.

"On the second day of operations, all staff members were acutely cognizant of the heightened sense of urgency that permeated the atmosphere, as they assiduously endeavored to refine their culinary skills and provide an exceptional dining experience for their patrons. In light of this, we opted to sample the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board, a delectable ensemble of olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola. Upon savoring the assortment, we were struck by the unparalleled quality of the capicola and proscuitto, which were undoubtedly the most flavorsome we have had the pleasure of indulging in. Furthermore, the gorgonzola boasted an unforgettable combination of a pungent bleu cheese essence and the velvety texture of brie, thereby rendering it a true gastronomic masterpiece. In addition, our curiosity was piqued by the notion of consuming a cheeseburger within an Italian eatery, and thus, we decided to relish the Pat Lafrieda Burger, which featured a brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and tuscan fries. To our delight, the burger proved to be remarkably scrumptious. Lastly, no culinary excursion would have been complete without partaking in the sublime pleasure of the establishment's signature tiramisu, which, much to our satisfaction, transcended our expectations and emerged as the most exquisite specimen we have had the privilege of sampling anywhere. For those seeking to enhance their dining experience, we recommend requesting a table situated along the outer perimeter windows, thereby affording breathtaking vistas of The Strip. Additionally, we suggest that you bring your camera, as the captivating entree cakes crafted by Buddy and his team are certain to evoke a desire to capture their splendor and serve as enduring mementos of your gastronomic adventure."

I love independent/art/documentary/not-mainstream movies, so consequently, Camelview is one of my favorite spots as they are one of the few theaters here in the valley that gets these films.

Positive things about the theater: 
*Great movies! 
*Friendly employees
*Reasonably sized drinks (movie theater "bucket-o-cola" drinks are a pet peeve of mine and their small is equivalent to a medium soda from a fast food restaurant, which is just perfect) 
*Yummy cinnamon almonds for sale at the concession stand
*A retro-y feel 

Negatives
*Older theater that feels a bit rundown
*No stadium seating
*Seats that are not particularly comfortable

Point of note (not positive or negative)
*because of the type of movies they show, it seems like it is often popular with an older crowd of moviegoers. This can make for a sortof unique moviegoing experience if you come from a different demographic.

It is a fun spot that we manage to visit every couple of months. I wish that there were more options for Art films here in the Valley, but for the moment I do love Camelview, because I don't really have a choice in the matter ;)

Thanks to the exhaustive and meticulous evaluations proffered by Yelp reviewers, I was able to identify and select this moving company with confidence. As an individual who resides solo, I experienced considerable apprehension regarding the prospect of contracting the services of a moving company. However, upon initiating contact with the organization, my trepidation was promptly alleviated due to their judicious and considerate approach. Prior to the move, they furnished me with a photograph and comprehensive biography of the estimator who would be communicating with me, thereby engendering a sense of security and trust. Punctuality being a paramount concern, I was gratified to observe that the team arrived at the designated hour, ready to commence their labors with alacrity. Although a minor inconvenience arose in connection with the reassembly of my trundle bed, which remains unresolved at present, the overall execution of the move was flawless. In light of my thoroughly satisfactory experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this moving company to any individual seeking such services.

I possess limited familiarity with establishments specializing in the retail of alcoholic beverages; however, my experiences at this particular store have been overwhelmingly positive.  The employees consistently exhibit a high level of customer service, manifesting in a friendly, accommodating, and unobtrusive demeanor.  On one occasion, I visited the store accompanied by my romantic partner, who expressed interest in a specific type of fermented malt beverage that the store did not have in stock.  The gentleman behind the counter promptly assured us that they would place an order for it.  Much to our delight, the subsequent visit yielded the desired beverage, which we purchased in considerable quantities.  Subsequent events are somewhat indistinct in my memory.

"The performance was satisfactory, but it failed to meet the lofty expectations generated by their ABCD competition. Nonetheless, I took into account the fact that they were executing two consecutive shows, each lasting an hour and a half, which rationalized the JBWKZ's decision to refrain from exerting themselves excessively. Consequently, the display was not utterly awe-inspiring, but they did incorporate certain captivating elements, such as state-of-the-art technology, to create an amusing experience. They also exhibited an admirable versatility by exploring diverse musical styles, ranging from those reminiscent of the 1940s, to Disney-inspired pieces, hip hop, punk, and even a few disco tracks, which evoked mirthful sentiments."

"An establishment offering alcoholic beverages of superior quality, given its strategic positioning and capacious interior. Ideal venue to initiate nocturnal revelries. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by the bouncer's insistence on scrutinizing my age verification, despite my obvious maturity, when requesting an unpretentious beverage. The potations themselves were indeed delectable, and a minuscule area designated for dancing was available. The elevated platform situated above the bar featured live performances by talented artists, which enhanced the overall enjoyment of the evening, particularly owing to the captivating presence of an attractive female vocalist."

"My affection towards the frozen coffee beverage was profound, and the culinary excellence of every dish I had the pleasure of consuming within these establishments' premises was truly exceptional, thereby rendering it my preferred morning repast venue while situated in close proximity to this location."

"Upon entering the establishment, I was taken aback by the revelation that DSW now carries an assortment of running shoes, a departure from their customary array of casual and formal footwear for men. Although it does not compare to the specialized inventory of a store such as Run for your Life or TrySports, it was gratifying to encounter a retailer that offers esteemed brands like Mizuno and Asics. My routine typically involves navigating the right-hand side of the store, where the male shoes are showcased, in addition to the rear clearance section. My sibling frequently visits this location, occasionally for extended periods, which is understandable given the extensive variety of options available on the women's side."

Instead of a long wait next door, I decided to try Waffallonia for the first time.  I ordered the waffle with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries.  At first the serving size of one waffle looked a bit small for my appetite.  However, joke was on me as I started digging more and more into this brunch.  The waffle was very filling and so good.  There were sugary bites that reminded me of a funnel cake.  The fruit was fresh and everything tasted great mixed together.  I am happy there was a wait next door which prompted me to try this as it was very worth it.  The atmosphere was cozy as well as the few seats inside were pressed up against a tiny counter.  Waffallonia was a cool place with fantastic waffles.

"Exceedingly gratifying culinary escapade!!! Although I had yet to indulge in the gastronomical delights offered by the Mesa branch of this esteemed eatery, I opted to partake in a delectable bowl of pasta, which not only satiated my hunger but also left me feeling profoundly appreciative of the exceptional service provided by my affable and attentive server, Ashley. In the event that you decide to grace this establishment with your presence, I implore you to request Ashley's assistance, as her vivacity, familiarity with the regular clientele, and unwavering dedication to providing an optimal dining experience are certain to engender an atmosphere of conviviality and merriment. Unquestionably, this visit constituted the most enjoyable encounter I have had the pleasure of experiencing at Oregano's, and I eagerly anticipate my next opportunity to savor the delectable Big Rig and Ashley's warm hospitality."

I stopped in here with the owner's girlfriend after she cut my hair. She kindly treated me to anything I wanted to eat and drink. wooo hoo! I ordered a Grey Goose and cranberry and a Las Vegas roll (my all time favorite sushi- even if it is fried). Both were delicious. Thank you!!

During our recent excursion from the airport to the convention center, my associates and I opted to pause for a culinary indulgence at a nearby IHOP, which we fortuitously encountered en route. The establishment was relatively unfrequented, with merely two additional groups present besides ourselves, thereby ensuring that our server, Shee, could provide us with prompt and attentive assistance. While the fare was unremarkable in terms of quality, it nevertheless satisfied our expectations for a venue of its ilk. Furthermore, this particular IHOP boasts proximity to the Pinball Hall of Fame, rendering it an ideal location for a morning repast. Will I revisit this eatery? Indeed, it is likely that I shall return.

This critique pertains exclusively to the Chippery and does not extend to the daiquiris, although it is plausible that they possess an equally delectable quality. (Though I wager they are scrumptious!) Meandering aimlessly through the Forum Shops, seeking a minuscule repast prior to returning home, my companions opted for daiquiris, which afforded me the opportunity to investigate the edibles proffered by the establishment. Upon navigating through the throngs of individuals eagerly awaiting their frozen beverages, I discovered an array of flavored potato chips, both reasonably priced at $3 and $5 per pouch, depending on its magnitude. 
  Unfortunately, the level of hospitality displayed by the staff did not align with my expectations, thereby diminishing the overall rating. Despite this, the Chippery constitutes a hidden treasure for an economical and modest snack, albeit one must exercise caution when interacting with the attendants during the late afternoon hours at Caesars.

It's a maze of toys that you won't find at most department stores. 

I like the organization. It makes it easy to go the the area you want. All toys in their proper spot, divided into Toddler toys, board games, stuffed animals, learning toys, dolls, sports toys, action figured, cars, etc. 

I was serious about the maze thing, lol. There is 1 entrance and 1 exit and they are not interchangeable :) When you first walk in, because they know children so well and their ability to walk in a door and then break out into an all out sprint in all directions, you are guided through a few isles that curve around (they are chalk full of toys, of course) and THEN you get to the main isle. 

My check out experience was awesome. The lady actually noticed that I was hiding something my nieces view and she made sure to scan it when she wasn't looking and to double bag it :D I love her. 

Prices range, but the toys here do seem to be pricier in general compared to most department stores, but like it said, they have a much wider variety.

"The diminutive dimensions of the eatery do not detract from its ambiance, which exudes a convivial and welcoming aura, while the judicious deployment of embellishments and accoutrements contributes to an overall sense of refinement and sophistication; the attentive and proficient service further enhances the culinary experience. The Pad See Ew, a stir-fried rice noodle dish imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile replete with a variety of spices, is somewhat let down by a modest serving size, which, though perhaps understandable given its placement on the lunch menu, leaves a tad bit to be desired. In contrast, the Pad Thai, a dish consisting of stir-fried rice noodles, chicken, and a flavorsome sauce, boasts an impressive quantity that complements its commendable quality, with each component displaying a satisfying texture and taste; indeed, the dish elicits unreserved praise and ensures that future visits to this establishment will be forthcoming."

This culinary establishment is exceptionally delectable. The expedient drive-thru service remains available, enabling patrons to relish the convenience; the employee who attended to my order demonstrated remarkable alacrity and congeniality, constituting an impressive aspect of the experience.

The poultry appendages, specifically the wings, underwent preparation with utmost precision, resulting in a flawless execution. However, the supplementary items presented a minor drawback. We opted for French fries and potato salad, the former satisfying my companion's taste buds while the latter, despite its palatable quality, featured an unexpectedly diminutive serving size, barely sufficient to justify the cost of $1.89, thereby warranting a four-star rating.

Apart from this minor shortcoming, the eatery earns high praise, elevating it to a formidable status among competitors. Patrons are advised to bypass the supplementary dishes and focus on the exceptional chicken wings, allowing them to combine various flavors to their liking without incurring disappointment.

This establishment has become one of my most cherished venues in Las Vegas, owing to its exceptional value and captivating atmosphere. For the paltry sum of $9, I was able to indulge in two shots and a beer, an offer that I found impossible to resist. The clientele was a diverse assortment of individuals, which added to the allure of the karaoke performance that took place there. On the Saturday evening that we visited, the ambiance was lively and engaging, albeit somewhat congested and permeated with smoke. It is worth noting that those who are sensitive to cigarette smoke may find this environment less than ideal. The bartenders were proficient in their pours, dispensing generous quantities of liquor with precision and skill. The remaining staff members were affable and courteous, contributing to an overall pleasant experience. Notably, the restrooms conformed to the traditional dive bar standard, with a solitary toilet facility that often resulted in a delay for patrons seeking to relieve themselves. Thus, it is advisable for female patrons to exercise caution and avoid breaking the seal, as they may encounter a brief wait before gaining access to the facilities.

"Leith Links, situated in the northern precincts of Edinburgh, serves as a verdant oasis, offering a serene ambiance and myriad recreational opportunities for residents and visitors alike. This expansive green space, replete with winding pathways, play areas for children, and designated zones for canine companions, provides an idyllic setting for leisurely strolls, invigorating runs, or simply savoring the natural beauty of the surroundings. Although comparable to the Meadows in terms of its appeal as a popular gathering spot, Leith Links enjoys a more tranquil atmosphere, largely due to the absence of throngs of students converging upon the area for picnics. However, it's worth noting that the northeastern sector of the park may occasionally be subject to unpleasant olfactory sensations, courtesy of the proximate sewage facilities. \n\nDespite its peaceful ambiance, Leith Links hosts a diverse array of activities and events throughout the year. Within its borders, one can find allotments and a Children's Orchard, which serve as hubs of community engagement and sustainability. Additionally, the park plays host to various cultural celebrations, including the Leith Festival in June and the Edinburgh Mela in August, showcasing the rich tapestry of local and international talent. Furthermore, Leith Links lays claim to a unique distinction: it was here that the rules of golf were first codified, earning it the title of the true birthplace of golf, a fact that challenges the long-held notion that St Andrews holds this honor."

"Ubiquitous yet unremarkable, this establishment offers a diverse array of fresh and reasonably priced culinary options, rendering it a frequent destination for my midday repasts. The half-and-half combinations available for their soups, salads, and sandwiches are particularly appealing, as they afford me the opportunity to sample multiple offerings without committing to a single dish. The Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini Alfredo pasta, and Cesar salad are timeless classics, executed with varying degrees of success. However, the ambiance is occasionally marred by the intrusive sound of sweeping, as staff members persist in using a brush broom to clean the carpet in close proximity to my table, generating a substantial amount of dust and detracting from the overall dining experience. Despite these minor drawbacks, this venue remains a reliable choice for a hasty and satisfying meal."

"Culinary excellence and immaculate ambiance converge at this esteemed eatery. The chef emerges from the kitchen to engage with patrons and ensure a satisfactory dining experience. Although I do not subscribe to a plant-based diet, the vegan options tantalized my taste buds. In particular, the 'gardein beef', 'gardein fish', and 'gardein chicken' dishes showcased exceptional flavor and creativity. Additionally, the innovative 'Sweet Sour Scallops' (king oyster mushrooms sliced, breaded, and fried) offered a vegan twist on the classic sweet and sour pork dish, further solidifying the restaurant's commitment to gastronomic ingenuity. My plans to revisit this culinary gem are already underway, and I highly recommend that others follow suit."

"I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this establishment. Upon entering, I procured a colossal frozen beverage synonymous with the city of Las Vegas from Purple Zebra. Unfortunately, my maternal figure was experiencing hunger pangs. Following a brief conversation with an accommodating host, we were escorted to our table. My expectations for the margarita, given the restaurant's cultural cuisine, were not met, as it was subpar. Despite the server's benevolence in replacing it with an alternative margarita, the second iteration proved to be equally disappointing. Therefore, I would advise against ordering said beverage. However, the remaining dishes were truly exceptional. The carnitas tacos embodied the essence of love, with each bite enveloped in rich, velvety flavors. Furthermore, the guacamole garnished with pomegranate seeds induced an almost euphoric response. Its creamy texture and subtle sweetness left me utterly satiated. Additionally, I sampled the green rice, which although visually resembling regurgitated matter, transported my taste buds to a realm of pure delight upon consumption. In conclusion, I wholeheartedly endorse visiting this venue."

I thoroughly relished the culinary experience that I had the pleasure of indulging in at this establishment, and I would unhesitatingly return to partake in their gastronomical offerings once again. The hospitality accorded to me by the staff was warm and welcoming, while the fare served was of an exceptional quality, rivalling that of Bankok Balcony, a renowned Thai restaurant located in Squirrel Hill. Although the interior space may be somewhat limited in dimensions, it exudes an intimate ambiance that complements the delectable cuisine served within its cozy confines.
Great food. Kind of pricy for the portions but it is great food!! Makes you feel good about what you are eating!!

This is a restaurant inside of the Fiesta Resort Conference Center. It deserves it's own entry here on yelp. Now we didn't get to have the complete restaurant experience here due to it being late, and our only reason for being here is a flight missed connection. \nI have to give 2 thumbs up for the service in the lounge area with a smiling face by Jenn the waitress. She had to work late with the rush of hungry travelers, but she didn't seem to mind. \nI had a soup and salad. On the menu it said \"Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup.\" I had to try it and wow...it's the best I've ever had anywhere. So, here in our situation tired, hungry, and stuck...I discovered the best Tortilla soup ever. I wish I had the recipe. If anyone ever gets graced with it, please let me know. Delicious!

"For those who have yet to experience the culinary delights of Wildflower, allow us to enlighten you on the charming ambiance and delectable fare that awaits your arrival. Boasting an expansive, well-lit interior, this cozy eatery offers an array of mouthwatering options sure to satiate even the most discerning palates. From their signature soups, sandwiches, salads, and freshly baked pastries, each dish is meticulously crafted using only the finest ingredients, ensuring a truly satisfying repast. For the uninitiated, we highly recommend indulging in their flavorful spinach salad, sans bacon, or the egg, tomato, and feta cheese garnished breakfast sandwich, skillfully presented on a crispy ciabatta bun. Furthermore, the prices at Wildflower are eminently reasonable, making it an ideal destination for a leisurely meal or a quick bite, without breaking the bank."

"My appraisal of this establishment is somewhat dichotomous, as while they proffer an impressive and delectable array of soups, sandwiches, and wraps, their smoothies fall short of my expectations. Specifically, they incorporate an excessive amount of orange juice into the majority of their offerings, which results in a discordant flavor profile that belies their advertised flavors. Despite my repeated attempts to sample various flavors, I am consistently disenchanted by the prevalence of orange juice or other fruit juices employed as a base, thereby diminishing my overall satisfaction with their smoothies. Notwithstanding, I must acknowledge that Franktuary's Blue smoothie stands out as a notable exception to this trend, earning it my unwavering endorsement."

"An exceptional establishment, distinguished by its fastidious attention to cleanliness and an impressive level of customer service; the culinary offerings, while not without their merits, were somewhat inconsistent in terms of flavor profile, specifically, the Devil's Egg, which lacked any discernible zest, was a disappointment, while the Short Ribs, though tender, were over-salted to an extent that made them unpalatable, save for a few bites; however, upon requesting an additional dash of spice, the Andouille Sausage, Shrimp, and Grits combination proved satisfying, albeit the latter component, the grits, seemed incongruous with the other elements of the dish, but ultimately, the meal concluded on a positive note with the delectable Donut appetizer."

"The cost of our midday repast at this esteemed hostelry was somewhat prohibitive, given the exorbitant tariff of forty dollars for a meal that, while undoubtedly delectable, did not seem to justify such an extravagant expenditure. However, as we awaited the preparation of our luxurious accommodations, we opted to kill some time by partaking of a light refreshment, which, much to our surprise, turned out to be a veritable culinary masterpiece! The chopped salad, replete with an array of fresh vegetables, including celery, peas, lettuce, and an assortment of other ingredients, was truly a gastronomic delight, with each component boasting unparalleled freshness and flavor. Furthermore, the dressing applied to this delectable dish was remarkably light and subtle, thereby enhancing the overall experience. Additionally, we were served a novel taco-like shell, reminiscent of Chinese shrimp chips, embellished with sesame seeds, which added a pleasing texture to the meal. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the French-sized grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich, served with a side of unimpressive, non-crispy fries that fell short of our expectations, particularly considering the hefty price tag of seventeen dollars. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment, situated adjacent to the Wynn pool, was undeniably captivating, and we would highly recommend the aforementioned salad to any individual seeking a truly exceptional gustatory experience in the heart of Las Vegas."

"The gastronomical experience afforded by the pizza is merely satisfactory, whereas the pasta dishes are truly exceptional, thereby establishing this eatery as an optimal destination for either a tranquil family gathering or an intimate date, with the added benefit of some delectable salads augmenting the menu."

I really enjoy this place. It's low-key and upscale. Drinks are expensive but they're made on the strong side. The food is really go too. I've never had a dish I didn't enjoy. \n\nIt's a great place to sit down and enjoy a cocktail and have a conversation. The crowd looks like 26 and up.  I consistently have a positive experience here.

We executed a reservation via OpenTable for breakfast, which proved to be a judicious decision, as it precluded us from having to endure a thirty-minute wait in line. Upon entering the establishment, we observed numerous unoccupied tables, which rendered the prolonged queue somewhat perplexing. As we arrived at 10:30, we had the opportunity to sample both breakfast and lunch offerings.

My mother was particularly eager to indulge in their all-you-can-eat macarons, but unfortunately, they failed to meet her expectations, as they lacked the requisite texture of melting in one's mouth. However, several of their other dessert items, such as the creme brulee and fruit tart, were quite delectable. Their crepe offering, on the other hand, was disappointing - the batter was insipid, and the berries were too tart. Moreover, the candied nuts they utilized possessed an unpleasant refrigerated flavor.

In contrast, all the meat dishes I sampled were quite satisfying. The prime rib was cooked to perfection, and the pork apple dish was scrumptious - vastly superior to the parched, chewy offerings at The Bacchanal. Additionally, their hot cherries were palatable. It's amusing that they even offer sushi.

The service was adequate, given the nature of a buffet. However, our server visited our table so infrequently that we were compelled to place our finished dishes on a nearby table.

Ultimately, despite some inconsistencies, I found the food enjoyable, and I would likely return. An abundance of delectable desserts and meats is always an attractive feature for me.

I went out to Outback for a light snack. I was seated promptly without any delays. My server was very attentive and helpful with the menu. I ordered the side salad along with the soup for the day. The salad was fresh and crisp and I promise they have the best garlic croutons. The soup was better than I expected it was a creamy onion and cheese soup. And of course they brought out their famous bread and butter!

"An ideal venue for a rapid, wholesome repast, offering an assortment of flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups, and even quesadillas!  The caloric content of each item is conveniently displayed adjacent to its respective menu entry, thereby allowing patrons to make informed selections. 

I thoroughly enjoyed the chipotle chicken wrap, which contained a generous helping of fresh, crisp vegetables and a perfectly cooked flatbread, possessing an optimal balance of softness and texture. The chipotle sauce added a delightful touch of spice without overpowering the dish. My sole criticism pertains to the somewhat limited quantity of chicken, as a more copious serving would have elevated the culinary experience to an even higher level of satisfaction. I highly recommend complementing your meal with a drizzle of peppadew hot sauce, a vast improvement upon the ubiquitous Tabasco. 

While the establishment's present location may not be ideally situated for those residing in Scottsdale, the diverse array of delectable options, available at eminently reasonable price pointsa mere $5 secured a wrap, beverage, and choice of chips, cookie, or browniemore than compensates for any inconvenience arising from the distance. Indeed, it would be challenging to locate a comparable venue offering such a plethora of mouthwatering selections at similarly affordable prices."

They possess an incredibly prime location, situated adjacent to Arizona State University and a plethora of thriving businesses. Their seating arrangements are abundant, and parking is readily accessible, making it a veritable haven for patrons. This, coupled with the exceptional quality of the staff, elevates the establishment to a rating of four stars. The personnel are unwavering in their dedication to providing exemplary service, exhibiting utmost friendliness, proficiency, and helpfulness. They are meticulous in ensuring that each customer avails themselves of the full scope of amenities included in their purchase, such as the complimentary cream cheese that accompanies certain items. It is not uncommon for establishments to overlook particulars of this nature, allowing patrons to depart without realizing their oversight. However, the staff here takes the time to thoughtfully remind forgetful customers of their entitlements. While the culinary offerings may not be the most extraordinary aspect of this eatery, they are by no means subpar. The menu boasts an assortment of unremarkable yet satisfying selections, including bagels that, while unexceptional, remain a popular choice among regulars.
