Friend said he seen Guy from the food network do a show here, so we decided to come and check it out. Got here at 6:30am on the dot and ordered the Enchiladas,  the plate was very good and had good taste to it. \n\nWas expecting a bit more but wasnt bad.

"Nostalgia permeates my being as I reminisce about the erstwhile frequentation of McAlp's, a culinary establishment situated directly across the street from my former place of employment. The ambiance, characterized by a distinctive je ne sais quoi, fosters a sense of familiarity and comfort, while the gastronomical offerings, comprising an array of delectable dishes, satiate my epicurean inclinations. Moreover, the desserts, a symphony of sweetness, tantalize my taste buds and evoke memories of indulgent excess. It is gratifying to observe that certain venues in the Phoenix metropolitan area, McAlp's being a prime example, have elected to maintain their traditional appearance, atmosphere, and business philosophy, thereby preserving a tangible connection to the past. The mere thought of partaking in their culinary delights once again has ignited a craving within me, compelling me to secure a future appointment in the downtown area, thereby facilitating a return visit to this beloved eatery."

"While indulging in the annual ritual of Spring Training in Scottsdale, my carnivorous inclinations led me to seek out an establishment proffering exceptional steak.  My inquires, to which numerous individuals kindly responded, consistently endorsed Mastro's Ocean Club.  Subsequently, I comprehended the reason behind such unanimous recommendations.  Upon entering the venue, an ambiance imbued with vitality enveloped me, as the bar area, though bustling with patrons, remained sufficiently accommodating to ensure prompt beverage service.  Furthermore, the culinary offerings, particularly the steak, proved to be a veritable gastronomic masterpiece, ranking among the top three specimens I have had the pleasure of consuming.  Thus, I wholeheartedly advocate for a visit to this esteemed eatery, despite its moderately elevated pricing, as the experience promises to be eminently worthwhile."

"Initially, the wine catalogue appears utterly preposterous, yet it's an integral component of their distinctive modus operandi. I'm referring to the absurdity of the wine list, which surpasses the dimensions of a telephone directory in magnitude, and its organization, which prioritizes price over varietal and regional categorization. This extensive list caters to the needs of two establishments, Cowboy Ciao and Kazimierz, the former of which boasts an impressive track record, primarily attributed to its prime location, captivating ambiance, and delectable culinary offerings. In the company of my companion and father, along with his recent spouse, I opted for a particularly esteemed wine from K Vintners, priced at $200, which yielded a memorable experience that lingers in my mind, augmented by my proficiency in wine recognition."

"Upon returning home from Tempe this evening, I opted to halt at this establishment for a culinary experience. My initial impression was that of a spotlessly clean ambiance, cordial staff members, and an unwavering commitment to serving delectable fare. Specifically, I relished a tender and savory ribeye steak sandwich, complemented by crispy fries and a delightful array of onion rings. While I have had the pleasure of indulging in numerous satisfactory steak sandwiches throughout the valley, this particular rendition stood out as one of the most exceptional. Furthermore, I must admit that my taste buds were thoroughly impressed by the onion rings, as they profoundly altered my preconceived notions regarding this staple dish. Consequently, I would confer upon this eatery a well-deserved rating of four stars, with the possibility of a perfect five-star evaluation pending my future sampling of their signature burger."

"Wow, this venue is utterly remarkable! My spouse and I had been aware of its existence for approximately sixty days prior to our inaugural visit last Saturday, and we were so captivated by its charm that we decided to return the following day. It exudes an atmosphere of warmth and intimacy, providing an ideal setting for indulging in a cup of coffee and savoring a state of deep relaxation. Their cinnamon roll boasts an exceptional quality, particularly with regard to the frosting, which tantalizes the taste buds with its sweet and velvety texture. Furthermore, their waffle sandwich, enhanced by the rich flavor of Bechamel, may very well rank among the most delectable breakfast sandwiches I have had the pleasure of consuming. During our second visit, we invited my wife's cousin Johnny to join us, and his enthusiasm for the sandwich was equally as fervent as our own. Consequently, we have made a collective decision to frequent Bread and Butter on a weekly basis, alternating between Saturdays and Sundays. I wholeheartedly endorse this establishment for a delightful breakfast experience, and I eagerly anticipate sampling their luncheon offerings in the near future."

"Everything was remarkable at this esteemed dining establishment, with the notable exception of the primary protein component of my entree, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations in terms of doneness. Specifically, the 10 oz filet mignon that I had ordered, prepared medium rare with an accompaniment of truffle butter, was regrettably overcooked to a degree that could be described as falling between medium and medium well. As this venue purports to specialize in the culinary preparation of steaks, I felt compelled to deduct points from my overall assessment due to the unfortunate discrepancy in cooking time. 

Notwithstanding the aforementioned issue, I must admit that the garden salad and the assortment of vegetables that we shared, including broccolini, spiced maple carrots, and a delectable lobster mac and cheese, were indeed quite delicious. 

Furthermore, the quality of service provided by the staff was commendable, and the ambiance and musical accompaniment contributed significantly to the overall pleasantness of the dining experience. However, I cannot help but express my disappointment regarding the fact that, despite the premium price point associated with their steak offerings, the kitchen was unable to execute my specific request for doneness. It is my sincere hope that future patrons will not encounter similar difficulties in this regard."

"We opted to visit this establishment during the Labor Day weekend, specifically on the Saturday evening, and were pleased to discover that the crowd was not overly congested. Upon entering, we managed to secure a prime location in the rear of the venue, where we were able to comfortably ensconce ourselves upon plush couches. Our server proved to be both cordial and knowledgeable, providing us with insightful recommendations regarding the extensive wine list, which we took advantage of by sampling a few selections. Additionally, we indulged in some delectable pastries, albeit at a somewhat elevated cost. Nonetheless, our overall experience was quite satisfactory, and we would unquestionably consider returning in the future."

"Upon entering the establishment, I opted to sample their pork rib and fatty brisket offerings, and my culinary experience was rather satisfactory. Despite my inherent skepticism towards pork ribs, the meat literally fell off the bone, boasting an unparalleled tenderness and juiciness that left me pleasantly surprised. The brisket, with its judicious balance of marbling, showcased a profound depth of flavor that further enhanced my dining delight. 

The triumvirate of barbecue saucessweet, smokey, and white thunderpresented a diverse array of taste sensations. While the sweet iteration adhered to traditional barbecue sauce conventions, the smokey variety garnered my utmost approval, with its rich, velvety texture and subtle smokiness that complemented the meats perfectly. The white thunder, on the other hand, offered an intense, fiery burst of flavor that, while not necessarily my cup of tea, may appeal to those who relish a more incendiary gustatory experience. 

With prices ranging from approximately $8 and up, this eatery's fare aligns with industry standards. Considering its proximity to my workplace, I would unquestionably consider returning to partake in their delectable barbecue delights once again."

"The ambiance exudes an air of sophisticated metropolitan charm, evoking the aesthetic sensibilities of an urbanite cognoscenti. The chai tea latte, in particular, is a veritable masterpiece, ranking among the finest specimens I've had the pleasure of sampling within the city limits of Las Vegas. However, a caveat emptor should be exercised when perusing the breakfast menu, as the prices are somewhat prohibitive, particularly in light of the fact that the bagels themselves are merely a generic, mass-produced brand (Sara Lee); yet, an ameliorating factor can be found in the form of a delectable honey-butter accompaniment, which serves to mitigate the sting of the premium pricing."

Between 4 and 5 stars.  Everything was so spicy.  Great flavors.  Especially loved the fried avocado! yum yum yum.  I believe the owner was taking care of us and she was super friendly and had great suggestions for a Thai novice such as myself.  \n\nWine was half-priced on Thursdays and we took full advantage of this :) We stayed for hours, drinking and munching on the appetizers we split.  This is a small restaurant and it was packed.  There are apparently a lot of people in Summerlin who love this place and for good reason: It was delicious.  Beautiful lighting too.  Don't let the strip mall location fool you.  Great for a date spot or happy hour with the girls.

"The scent emanating from this product is rather pleasant, thus eliciting an olfactory response of approval and satisfaction from potential consumers; furthermore, its cost is relatively low, making it an economical option for those seeking to acquire a gift that does not necessitate a substantial financial investment; additionally, the item's design and packaging subtly allude to the notion that the recipient may benefit from utilizing such a product, thereby mitigating any potential offense that might arise from overtly broaching the topic of personal hygiene; lastly, this location offers a diverse array of gift options suitable for any menopausal women who may be included on one's list of intended recipients during the holiday season."

"I believe that this particular brunch buffet ranks among the finest in the city, boasting an impressive array of delectable offerings, including a customizable omelet station, exceptional egg dishes, and a diverse selection of sweet treats. Moreover, the champagne utilized in the preparation of mimosas was of superior quality, contributing to an overall dining experience that was truly gratifying. So much so, in fact, that my diminutive roommate, who is notorious for her hearty appetite, indulged in a marathon three-hour feast, ultimately succumbing to a prolonged state of culinary-induced lethargy that persisted for a significant portion of the day."
We had the lunch menu and it was great .I am sure I will be back next time in Vegas .

"Remarkable array of options! 

Arrived mere moments before the clock struck three on a Monday afternoon. There were a mere four patrons ahead of us, yet, for reasons unknown, the process of being seated required an agonizing ten minutes. Do not attempt to test your fortunes further! The queue grows at an exponential rate as the hours approach dinner time, and the intelligent diners are not going to vacate their tables promptly, as they, too, desire to peruse the evening's offerings. 

I must confess a twinge of disappointment with certain aspects: the eggs Benedict proved impossible to slice with the utensil provided, and upon attempting to bite into it, the texture was unpleasantly rubbery...I possess an immense fondness for meat, but the carving station offered a meager two options (top sirloin and flank steak?)...The confections were undeniably adorable, but a few were slightly awry, and none inspired within me an overwhelming desire for seconds. Moreover, I found it necessary to request milk, as some desserts exhibited an excessive richness or sweetness (a peculiar sensation, as I have never thought anything was too sugary)...Lastly, we departed approximately thirty minutes after the commencement of the evening meal, yet no discernible variation in the fare being served was apparent. Dishes were replenished, but that was the extent of it. 

Yes, the cuisine was satisfactory, but I harbored expectations of sampling dishes that are not part of my customary culinary experience and that would elicit an exceptional degree of delight. Thus, I subtract a star for the absence of any dish that compelled me to crave additional portions."

"An exceptional ambiance and exemplary hospitality were palpable throughout my recent dining experience at this esteemed establishment. However, I must express a modicum of disappointment regarding the lack of potency in the mixed drinks I ordered, as I failed to perceive even a subtle alteration in my sensory faculties after consuming two cocktails. Nonetheless, the flavorsome popcorn and remarkable albacore tuna sashimi left an indelible impression on my gastronomic sensibilities, while the prime rib, augmented by its unique presentation, proved to be an unforgettable culinary delight. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this venue to out-of-town visitors and eagerly anticipate future opportunities to sample additional items from their extensive menu."

"Indulging in an extraordinary culinary experience on the occasion of one's annual celebration of life, surrounded by dear loved ones and partaking in a veritable feast of sushi delicacies that would inspire envy in even the most discerning deities."

They indeed facilitate both takeout and delivery services, offering a delectable assortment of culinary delights that are arguably more flavorful than those offered by the majority of establishments specializing in transporting comestibles to patrons' doorsteps. The dimensions of their medium-sized pizza, measuring a generous ten inches in diameter, constitute an ideal quantity of sustenance for a solitary individual. Furthermore, the personnel were remarkably convivial and engaging, displaying an eagerness to converse and furnishing comprehensive responses to any inquiries we posed. It is indubitable that we shall repeat the process of procuring nourishment from them at some point in the future.

EM Cafe, a culinary haven, launched two years prior and garnered immense popularity, principally owing to its unpretentious and airy ambiance. Boasting towering ceilings, pristine white walls that serve as an artistic canvas for local talents, and a spacious table in the center, ideal for communal feasting or sizable gatherings, the eatery exudes an inviting charm. While the fare may be deemed unremarkable, it has recently experienced a slight decline in quality, specifically regarding the potatoes, which have elicited criticism. Nonetheless, the likes of sandwiches, omelets, and French toast continue to impress, with generous portions that, though not excessively vast, satisfy the appetite. This cozy establishment has become a mainstay in the Mile End neighborhood, defying the notorious reputation of Parc Avenue, where many businesses struggle to survive beyond the initial six months.
I'm on the fence on whether I like Aria or Cosmo better, but I know for sure that I like playing poker in Aria, so it is all the more convenient to stay there.

Great food!  Had the carne asada plato special which was really tasty! Friend had Killer Burrito off menu which he loved. Service was so so. The man at the register was fantastic. Drinks not refilled and no one came back to check on us. All forgivable.  We'll be back for sure.

I was impelled to visit this coffee shop due to the captivating nature of its name, which arrestingly caught my attention. Located in the Noda area, a region notorious for its chaotic parking conditions, this establishment boasts a unique advantage - its own private parking lot, an amenity that undoubtedly enhances its appeal. Additionally, it offers complimentary Wi-Fi, a feature that has become an indispensable requisite for contemporary patrons.

The interior of the shop exudes a warm and welcoming ambiance, characterized by approximately ten diminutive tables situated both within and outside the premises. Furthermore, it houses its own roasting machine, a facet that serves as a significant asset for ardent coffee connoisseurs. As a personal preference, I incline towards coffee with a robust and saccharine flavor profile, reminiscent of traditional Cuban coffee. Nonetheless, I inadvertently ordered a Hazelnut cold brew, which, although enjoyable, did not align with my penchant for sweeter coffee.

In pursuit of a suitable venue for academic pursuits, I elected to visit this coffee shop, dedicating three hours to productive endeavors. Following this duration, I opted to sample their Chai iced latte and lemon poppy muffin. While the latte exhibited commendable quality, it failed to leave an indelible impression on my palate as an unmissable beverage.

Notwithstanding, I am inclined to revisit this establishment, primarily owing to the exceptional amiability of its staff and an eagerness to experience their Cuban coffee during cooler climates.

I thoroughly relished myself. Despite the dearth of laudatory remarks proffered by numerous acquaintances. Her visage was more presentable than I had anticipated. The bottle service significantly contributed to an exceptional soiree. One bottle of ciroc for four females. We exhausted the entire contents and indulged in a rip-roaring time. The padded bench-style seating afforded comfort. The panorama visible from the bottle service sector was breathtaking. It's enjoyable to imbibe beverages, rise from one's seat, and engage in terpsichorean movements alongside one's companions. The stage accoutrements and performers substantially augmented the production's overall quality. I would unquestionably observe it once more.

"We experienced an exhilarating and vibrant ambiance, characterized by high levels of auditory stimulation and animated social interaction, which thankfully did not impede our ability to partake in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment, owing to the foresight of securing a prior reservation. Our server exhibited exceptional proficiency in providing attentive and timely service, ensuring that both the comestibles and potables arrived promptly at our table, and that our dining experience was further enhanced by the absence of any undesirable seating arrangements. My gastronomical inclinations leaned towards the unpretentious simplicity of a classic cheeseburger, which proved to be an unmitigated delight, leaving me in a state of wistful anticipation for its future repetition. Subsequently, my indulgence in the rich, chocolatey decadence of the brownie dessert precipitated an ephemeral sensation akin to transcending mortality, such was the intensity of its flavorsome gratification. Furthermore, the wine list presented an array of diverse and intriguing options, thereby catering to the varied preferences of its clientele. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly return to this restaurant, as it offers a superior example of American cuisine, skillfully prepared and presented with an air of elegance."

This place is awesome.  Persian/Middle Eastern food on the cheap.

If you want a nice casual, fast food experience with restaurant quality food, then this is the spot.  Lunch with a drink is easily under 8-9 bucks.

The food is served fresh and is packed with flavor.  I usually order the Kubideh combo which comes with 2 skewers opting with the Ground chicken and Ground lamb.  So much food for only 8-9 bucks.

A rather unobtrusive coffee establishment situated directly beneath the esteemed Elizabeth Arden's Red Door Spa, offering a limited selection of baked goods, yet I opted for a refreshing iced coffee beverage priced at three dollars. Although the consistency proved somewhat diluted to my liking, its revitalizing properties were most welcome during a sweltering afternoon. Lamentably, no sugar water was apparent to enhance its flavor profile, a factor that might have elevated the overall experience.
Food is ok but service is good, I mainly come here to watch the football game and have a few drinks TVs on every wall with different games going on and the patios big screen it's awesome.

"It is Saturday morning, and I am still on the road for another week; thus, it is imperative that I avail myself of the opportunity to engage in the process of laundering my garments at this establishment, which boasts of possessing easy accessibility and maintaining a high level of cleanliness. Furthermore, I have been informed by a courteous attendant that they offer an additional service known as fluff and fold, which costs $1.50 per pound. This laundromat appears well-equipped with numerous machines, complimentary Wi-Fi, a change machine, an assortment of soap products, television sets, air conditioning, ceiling fans, carts, folding tables, seating areas, and other amenities. Notably, its location on the corner provides convenient access for truck drivers, who can park their vehicles on the street adjacent to the premises. I shall unquestionably return to this laundromat in the future."

Love, love,  love the Cajun barbecue shrimp! Be sure to order extra bread so you can soak up all of the yumminess! Great service, great drinks, especially if you are here before all the crowds. And yes, you must like country music...it IS a country bar with awesome music and some amazing live bands wed-sun. Did I mention the amazing shrimp! :)

"Although I did not opt to lodge at this establishment during my recent visit, I did partake in the gaming facilities available on the premises. I must say that I had an enjoyable experience, culminating in a financial gain of a couple hundred dollars, which left me feeling content and satisfied. However, I must admit that the procurement of beverages did prove to be somewhat protracted, but I refrained from harboring any animosity towards the staff due to the delay. Furthermore, I have it on good authority that the roller coaster located within the confines of this hotel is truly remarkable, and although I did not have the opportunity to indulge in its thrills during my most recent visit, I have fond memories of my previous experiences with it. In fact, I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit, during which I intend to sample the accommodations offered by this esteemed hostelry."

Great concept! I loved the individual portions just for the novelty of it. It might be useful to go with a buddy and pick out things to share.

Highlights included the pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried chicken, mushroom risotto, and truffled scalloped potatoes.

Lowlights: ramen (too salty), sushi (I didn't try any, but apparently it was the worst sushi ever), and some of the desserts were disappointing (rock hard red velvet cookies).

Cool idea with the mac and cheese bar, but one bowl can be shared with the table, as it's very rich and creamy, and the portions are pretty big. And you wanna save room for those king crab legs, right?

Maybe this place doesn't have the variety like other buffets, but they offer items that are different or use different ingredients, which makes it more interesting.

"The overall quality of the barbecue served at this establishment is truly commendable. In particular, their chipotle cheese-stuffed sausage is an absolute delight, with the cheese being particularly noteworthy for its rich, creamy texture and bold flavor profile. Additionally, their hushpuppies are also quite impressive, boasting a moist, fluffy interior that is reminiscent of a well-crafted conch fritter. Furthermore, their pulled pork, mac and cheese, and baked beans are all exceptional offerings, showcasing a masterful blend of flavors and textures. Patrons can choose from a diverse array of sauces, with their signature sauce being a personal favorite of mine - it skillfully balances the tanginess of a vinegar-based sauce with the richness of a tomato-based sauce, creating a truly unique and satisfying culinary experience. However, I must note that my experiences with their brisket and ribs have been somewhat inconsistent, with the former being less than desirable on one occasion and the latter being somewhat fatty and tough. Nevertheless, I remain optimistic that these instances were merely anomalies, and I look forward to continuing to support this local business, whose staff members consistently display a high level of professionalism and hospitality."

"My spouse and I had our inaugural dining experience at Presto today, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! We sampled their ahi tuna sliders, which were tantalizingly delicious, and their Greek pide, which was equally impressive. As someone who has never had pide previously, I was pleasantly surprised by the non-greasiness of the crust, which made for a refreshing change from the typical pizza experience that often leaves me feeling overwhelmed by excess oil. While I did note some dissatisfaction with the service in certain reviews, our server was quite attentive and efficient, alleviating any concerns I may have had regarding prolonged wait times. However, I must admit that my only criticism lies in their practice of pre-preparing all salads and storing them in a cooler, which led me to question the crispness and freshness of the ahi salad I initially intended to order, given that it had been sitting for several hours by the time I arrived to collect my food at 3 pm. Despite this minor reservation, I found the overall dining experience to be pleasant, and I am grateful to have a health-conscious eatery in such close proximity to my residence."

I can only confer upon this hotel a rating of four stars due to the fact that I did not have the opportunity to partake in an overnight stay and thereby experience the full scope of amenities and services offered by the Cosmopolitan. However, based on my cursory examination of the premises, I would venture to surmise that it is indeed deserving of a perfect five-star rating. I did, however, have the occasion to visit the casino on multiple occasions throughout both the day and night, and I must say that the interior design was nothing short of breathtaking, with strands of crystals suspended from the ceiling, creating an ambiance that was positively ethereal. The various clubs and shops located within the hotel were also of an exceptionally high caliber, although, alas, they were likely beyond my financial means. Nevertheless, I was able to indulge in the pleasure of watching my preferred sports team engage in a victorious performance on the screens situated within the Sports Book. Furthermore, I took note of the fact that the odds offered by the Cosmopolitan were more favorable than those available at my own casino, which served as an additional incentive for me to engage in wagering activities. In conclusion, it is my considered opinion that the Cosmopolitan is, at present, one of the premier hotels situated along the Las Vegas Strip.

I was in North Phoenix for a friend's birthday.  This place was choose by one of our mutual friends.  This place is very authentic!!!  The help speaks Cantonese! (and English) and were very helpful in their recommendations.  I would go back if I lived up there.

On Las Vegas Boulevard without being caught up in the chaos of the strip. My friends and I stopped by this bar to grab a drink and a quick bite before we headed to a movie at the South Point. Knowing that the casino would be packed, we came here.

At first, I was  hesitant to come because my first experience was disappointing. This second time, it was better. We entered around 10pm and sat ourselves at one of the side booths. The wait staff were slow to acknowledge our presence, but after we made it clear we were there, they were more attentive. 

The menu is extensive and that can backfire. Like I said, my first experience had me never wanting to come back. I didn't care for their chili. I was impressed with the extensive salad choices. On Thursday, they have a  BBQ chicken served over cold soba noodles with tons of veggies tossed in. The marinade for the chicken remind me of the Chinese style BBQ except it was more salty than sweet. The half portion was 8.95 and was enough to tide me over. I was trying to be healthy, but could not help stealing my friends fries. They were thick cut and fried to a golden brown. Absolutely perfect.

A bonus, they were playing so much 90's alternative. Nothing like some Smashing Pumpkins and Bush to remind me of my childhood.

"The aspect that I particularly cherish regarding this site, in contrast to the two locations I am accustomed to in Milwaukee, is the basement area dedicated to utilized vinyl records. Unlike the Milwaukee stores, which arrange their vinyl on the floor, densely packing it, necessitating me to sit on the ground, extract several albums, and relocate approximately twenty at a time, this location boasts seventy-five percent of its inventory stored within bins that enable me to peruse through them while standing. Moreover, the absence of other patrons in the basement permits me to indulge in an extended, uninterrupted examination of each album without feeling self-conscious or unwelcome, a luxury I do not enjoy at the 76th street Milwaukee store."

You will discover this culinary delight within the confines of an unpretentious watering hole referred to as Moon Doggies. I conveyed to Chris, proprietor of Naked City Pizza, my apprehension regarding the safety of visiting such an establishment after sunset. He assured me that it was primarily a gathering place for industry professionals and not to be concerned. 

In the company of my spouse and progenitor, I partook in a midday repast at this purported eatery. We opted against ordering their signature dish, pizza, and instead chose to sample their buffalo wings. Additionally, we requested the steak frites sub, a special dish inscribed on a blackboard within the premises. My parent had a chili cheese hot dog accompanied by a portion of french fried potatoes. 

The buffalo wings were thoroughly enjoyable, prepared precisely to my preference. We requested them to be served "hot," and they did not disappoint. My patriarch was quite taken by his chili cheese hot dog, adorned with an assortment of toppings including chili, cheese, pickles, onions, jalapenos, et cetera. Unfortunately, he did not express the same level of satisfaction with his fries. 

The steak frites sub was a colossal bread roll smothered in cheese and filled with beef that had been marinated in garlic, a creamy horseradish sauce, and shoestring fries. It was presented with a side of peppery gravy to be drizzled over the top. The quality of the sandwich was exceptional. The meat was copious and perfectly seasoned, thereby eliciting a positive response from my taste buds. 

The total cost of our meal for three individuals was twenty-five dollars, and we even took some leftovers home. I shall certainly return to this establishment in the near future to sample their pizza.

"We decided to partake in a midday repast at this eatery on an early Saturday afternoon, and upon our arrival, we observed that there was only a single additional table of patrons present, which did not come as a surprise given the novelty of the establishment. Our server, who appeared to be relatively new to her role, executed her duties proficiently. We opted for the Ma Po Tofu and the Baked Pork and Rice complemented by a Portuguese sauce, both of which exhibited palatable flavors. This restaurant offers a suitable venue for sampling Hong Kong-style western cuisine and serves as a commendable alternative to the abundance of Chinese eateries situated on Spring Mountain Road, particularly for those located on the eastern side of the city."

"While I do not frequent Dish for the purpose of indulging in an epicurean adventure, I must confess that I derive immense pleasure from the relaxed ambiance that permeates the establishment, particularly when seeking sustenance following a late night of revelry or as a salve for a lingering hangover. My preference is to place an order for a half grilled cheese sandwich, accompanied by a steaming cup of tomato bisque. I must say that I am quite enamored with the practice of serving a deviled egg as a complementary side dish, a thoughtful gesture that elevates the dining experience to a new level of sophistication. My unwavering fondness, however, lies with the black bean and rice burrito, a delectable entree that never fails to satiate my hunger. Furthermore, the musical selections played on the jukebox contribute to the overall convivial atmosphere, transforming Dish into a veritable haven for those seeking refuge from the mundane rigors of daily life."

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this quaint eatery twice within a 24-hour period during my excursion to Las Vegas. Their prices are extremely reasonable, and the culinary offerings are unexpectedly delectable. Upon sampling their garlic chicken wings, my spouse expressed satisfaction, whereas I found them to be slightly lacking in flavor, although the crispy garlic was quite palatable. I thoroughly enjoyed their salted fish and chicken fried rice, with a generous serving size that did not scrimp on the salted fish, a notable aspect that impressed me. Additionally, I purchased their jook for my father, who was indisposed, and he relished the salted pork accompanied by a thousand-year-old egg porridge; the flavors were adequately balanced, neither excessively salty nor overly watery. During our subsequent visit, my father opted for their curry beef, the quality of which I presumed to be satisfactory, given that he consumed the entire dish. We also indulged in their beef chow fun, which boasted an abundance of flavor derived from the intense heat of the stove. While there were other menu items we sampled, my overall impression of this modest yet charming restaurant, situated outside the Las Vegas Strip, is one of contentment. Furthermore, its location away from the strip ensures that dining here will not significantly impact your financial resources.

"Devoid of any frivolous or unnecessary expenses, the cost of services rendered by Dan, an individual in whom I have unwavering trust and with whom I have had the pleasure of acquaintance since his tenure at Chapman, was found to be eminently reasonable and altogether commensurate with the exceptional quality of workmanship and dedication evidenced in the maintenance and repair of my Audi vehicle, thereby precluding any potential grievances or dissatisfaction on my part."

Last night, in the company of some acquaintances, I visited this establishment and partook of their culinary offerings. The hospitality we received was quite impressive, as our server exhibited remarkable attentiveness, repeatedly refilling our beverages and even dividing the tab for us after we neglected to request it. My individual pizza, adorned with artichokes and sliced tomatoes, was truly exceptional, warranting the slightly elevated price due to the superior quality of its constituents. The other patrons at our table also expressed satisfaction with their meals, and by the conclusion of the evening, there remained no pizza uneaten. While I would advocate for a broader array of options, the overall experience was certainly worthy of repetition.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment surpass the customary fare found in traditional public houses, boasting an elevated level of sophistication and creativity that sets them apart from the standard menu items typically associated with such venues. My personal preferences inclined towards the savory tomato soup artfully crafted with the distinctive tang of goat cheese, the crispy goat cheese fritters, and the delectable butternut squash croquettes - each dish showcasing the kitchen's dedication to utilizing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. Furthermore, the extensive selection of expertly curated, locally brewed beers available on tap complements the cozy, dimly lit ambiance that permeates the interior, creating a welcoming environment that invites patrons to linger and indulge in the rich flavors and aromas of the culinary delights on offer."

"I thoroughly enjoy the fact that this establishment consistently maintains a high level of patronage, yet still manages to provide exceptional service and culinary offerings. Upon each visit, I have been impressed by the proficiency and attentiveness of the staff, who have demonstrated an unwavering commitment to ensuring a satisfying dining experience. Furthermore, the menu boasts an array of delectable pasta dishes, which I have had the pleasure of sampling on multiple occasions. Notably, their flank steak salad has proven to be a flavorful and nutritious option when I am in the rare mood for a healthier selection. Additionally, their Italian sodas are a refreshing delight, with the Hurricane variety being my personal favorite. In conclusion, this venue has become my preferred destination for Italian cuisine and is unequivocally worthy of a visit."

"An exceptional eatery situated in close proximity to the Concordia campus, offering an optimal setting for a hasty luncheon, a tranquil study area (particularly in the lower level), a delectable beverage, or a leisurely weekend indulgence, complete with poetry recitals on both Saturday and Sunday. Essentially, this establishment boasts a diverse array of attractions. The half panini and soup combination, available at an unbeatably affordable price point of under $10, represents an extraordinary value for students operating within a limited budget, much like myself. The lavender and rosemary infused lemonade, with its delightfully tangy and flavorful essence, stands out as particularly noteworthy, given the frequent tendency of lemonade to be overly diluted. While some might categorize this venue as simply another instance of an 'artsy' cafe prevalent throughout Montreal, the welcoming ambiance and thoughtfully arranged tables facilitate a thoroughly enjoyable experience, regardless of the purpose of one's visit. Furthermore, I personally would appreciate the reintroduction of shisha, as mentioned in a previous review, which would undoubtedly enhance the overall appeal of this already exceptional establishment."

Second time visiting this establishment, the culinary offerings were expedited with remarkable celerity during the peak lunch hour on a Saturday afternoon, exhibiting an impressive degree of gastronomical proficiency. The comestibles themselves were quite delectable, comprising a diverse array of flavorsome options such as Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, and Mongolian beef, all of which were relished with great enthusiasm. Furthermore, the chicken pad Thai was also savored with immense pleasure. Notwithstanding the piquant nature of our meals, we yearned for even greater fieriness, thus prompting us to recommend that patrons who share our predilection for spirited Thai cuisine should consider requesting their dishes be prepared at an intensity level of 11, an increment above the standard 10, in order to experience the full gamut of flavors that these dishes have to offer.

The food was great, but the service was disappointing.  We came here for a late lunch after spending a few hours at Qua Spa.  The pizza here was amazing, with generous toppings and a crispy crust.  Our server was not very responsive to getting water glasses filled and checking in on our meal.

I was told this was the best buffet in Vegas and I don't see how anywhere else can compete.  They had everything from snow crab, king crab, steak, prime rib, shrimp, and all of the other typical buffet foods.  More on the expensive side, but you have to go here if you go to Vegas.  All the crab I ate, must have been worth so much at a normal restaurant.  \n\nWhat can I say, when John Wall is chillin right outside, it must be good.  Everything was tasty and very flavorful.  Definitely going back next time I'm in Vegas.

Firstly, it's an exceptionally pleasant drinking establishment.  The barkeepers and support staff are truly remarkable!  If you possess an ardent affection for brewed beverages, we highly recommend indulging in their assorted sampling platter and experimenting with their diverse offerings; however, in our humble opinion, their crimson ale reigns supreme!

Having previously experienced the delectable tuna poke at Lulu's in Lahaina, Maui, BJ's faced formidable competition. Nonetheless, they managed to deliver a sublime interpretation of the dish. Additionally, the avocado egg rolls gratified my stomach immensely, and delightfully, they were utterly devoid of excessive oiliness.

The ambiance is convivial, boasting numerous televisions for viewing various athletic competitions, thereby ensuring a thoroughly enjoyable experience for patrons.

This establishment boasts an unparalleled dining experience, particularly in regards to their delectable chicken ceasar salad, which truly showcases a sublime harmony of flavors, with the dressing strikingly achieving a precise balance between tanginess and richness, thus catering to even the most fastidious palates; furthermore, their margarita pizza, prepared using a traditional wood-fired method, offers a delightful culinary excursion, although some patrons may prefer a slightly lighter crust, which can be readily addressed by requesting a brief cooking duration from the attentive servers, who, along with the captivating ambiance, contribute significantly to the overall enjoyment of one's repast.

"When financial constraints are a pressing concern and the day happens to be a Monday, HH serves as an optimal destination for those seeking a convenient and affordable dining experience. Previously, the establishment offered a medium one-topping pizza for the economical price of $5.55 every Monday evening. However, during a recent telephone call placed to order the special, it was brought to my attention that the promotion has since been modified to feature a large pizza for the marginally higher price of $5.99. This alteration, although seemingly insignificant, has significantly enhanced the overall value proposition for patrons, as it eliminates the need to purchase three pizzas to attain the same price point offered by competing chains. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at HH have consistently met my expectations in terms of both flavor and quality. Specifically, I prefer the thin crust variety and typically opt for sausage or pepperoni as my primary toppings, with additional ingredients such as red onion and black olives added at my discretion. Notably, the kitchen staff demonstrates a commendable attention to detail in their preparation of the pizzas, as excessive sauce application or skimpy cheese distribution are rarely encountered. Moreover, the pizzas retain their palatability upon reheating, making them an ideal choice for a satisfying meal."

We entered this esteemed eatery with the intention of partaking in an evening meal, and our culinary experience was indeed gratifying. I have had the pleasure of consuming masala dishes at various establishments, but none have compare to the piquant, delectable chicken masala I was served here. The hospitality of the staff was also commendable, as they exhibited a high level of friendliness and attention to detail. It is worth mentioning that I possess a great fondness for Indian cuisine; indeed, my affection for it is so profound that I feel compelled to express it through the use of an emoticon.

"Savor the delectable essence of Southern cuisine at its finest! The corn bread exuded an unparalleled excellence, setting the tone for the culinary journey that ensued. The BBQ Beef Ribs, accompanied by a triad of Mac & Cheese, Collard Greens, and Yams, showcased a symphony of flavors. The ribs boasted a rich, tangy infusion of North Carolina's signature vinegar-based seasoning, while the macaroni and cheese presented a delightfully creamy texture, complemented by the slightly sour, yet refreshing taste of the collard greens. The yams, imbued with a subtle sweetness, rounded out the quartet of dishes, leaving a lasting impression on the palate. Upon partaking in this gastronomic experience for the first time in Charlotte, utter satisfaction was the only plausible response. \n\nAmidst the reasonable prices, the quality of service proved to be yet another testament to the establishment's commitment to excellence. However, it is advisable to exercise caution when seeking parking accommodations, as availability may be limited. In light of this, it is recommended to utilize one of the adjacent parking structures, thereby ensuring a seamless dining experience."

Arrgh, just when I kicked my Chipotle habit, this place comes along.  Some great tortilla soup, custom made enchiladas that come out of the oven piping hot.  Why didn't some one come up with this earlier?  My biggest gripe is the parking lot, not the easiest to negotiate a little parking lot on 7th street during prime rush hour but worth it.  Oh they have great snickerdoodle and Mexican wedding cookies for purchase right at the counter!

"I have an affinity for this diminutive establishment; it pales in comparison to the colossal store situated in North Scottsdale. Nonetheless, I prefer perusing the merchandise herein due to the relatively tranquil ambiance that prevails most of the time. Although they do not stock an exhaustive inventory of items nor feature a food court or bar, they nevertheless possess an abundance of superior quality goods. Following a visit to Trader Joe's, I customarily patronize this store."

The concept is appealing to me, and I appreciate the uncomplicated nature of the menu. I have frequented this establishment on numerous occasions; however, an occasional setback arises when the chicken tends to exhibit a rubbery texture, albeit sporadically, contingent upon the particular chicken sourced for the dish, I presume.

Sierra Gold extends an invitation into a supremely welcoming ambiance, replete with delectable cuisine and gratifying indulgences, rendering it an optimal destination for enthusiasts of televised sports, video poker, or merely seeking a relaxing respite in either the bar or lounge area. 
Note: It is imperative to take cognizance of their felicitous Happy Hour, occurring daily from 3 pm to 7 pm and 12 am to 4 am, during which patrons can enjoy a fifty percent reduction on all potations and pizzas. 
In regards to their culinary offerings, Sierra Gold showcases an array of mouthwatering options, including: 
* Thin crust pizza (Although not a devotee, the quality and presentation of the pizza warrant recognition.)
* A bucket of wings (Offered in various flavors, garlic parmesan stands out as a paramount choice.)
* A bucket of curly fries (Irresistible and a quintessential accompaniment to any meal.)
* ZOOKIE (An absolute delight! A warm, gooey white chocolate macadamia nut cookie, complemented by a scoop of vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and finished with a drizzle of both chocolate and caramel sauce, expertly satiates any sweet tooth yearnings.)
Notwithstanding, the service, albeit somewhat lacking, is comprehensible given the late hour of the visit (midnight), thereby subtracting one star from the overall rating. Nonetheless, patrons can revel in the knowledge that this locally cherished establishment operates on a twenty-four-hour basis, providing an opportunity to indulge in their offerings at any time.

Came here frequently in college. Fell in love with the green curry. I had the chance to go to Thailand for myself and eat some of the dishes I learned to love at Thai Taste - and Thai Taste's versions of the dishes are amazing.

This elevated terrain, graced with an observation deck and an incomplete commemorative structure, offers a panoramic vista of the surrounding landscape on days when atmospheric conditions permit. During the summer solstice, the unobstructed solar radiation provides optimal conditions for photographers to capture breathtaking sunrises and sunsets from this vantage point. Throughout the year, this site serves as a platform for various artistic displays and live performances, such as the renowned Beltane Festival on April 30th, which celebrates the spring equinox. Additionally, on December 31st, it is one of seven hills that present spectacular pyrotechnic displays to usher in the new year. It is hoped that the natural beauty and accessibility of this hill will remain unaltered, as it provides a tranquil refuge for local inhabitants seeking respite from the bustling urban environment nearby. Personally, I find this location to be quite appealing and an excellent spot for a peaceful stroll, removed from the activity of the city mere meters away.

"The Great Wall presented itself as my inaugural dim sum experience, thereby transforming me into an untainted canvas, susceptible to the unrestricted influences of its gastronomical offerings. In light of my limited familiarity with the genre, my appraisal shall be founded upon my individualized, yet inherently biased, interpretation of the culinary establishment. Consequently, I shall articulate my impressions, while acknowledging the precedence established by Mr. K's comprehensive and perceptive analysis. His review serves as a succinct encapsulation of the restaurant's essence, thus rendering my supplementary remarks somewhat superfluous. Nonetheless, I shall proceed to offer my subjective assessment. The comestibles served at the Great Wall delighted my taste buds, conforming to my expectations of a satisfactory dining experience. The ambiance radiated liveliness and joviality, fostering an environment conducive to conviviality. Furthermore, the novelty of the eatery's presentation distinguished it from the customary venues populating Phoenix's gastronomic landscape, thereby providing a refreshing departure from the conventional. The convenience of its location along the highway also merits mention, as it facilitates accessibility for patrons. Geographically, the Great Wall occupies the initial shopping plaza positioned on the eastern side of 35th Avenue, situated just north of Camelback Road. For those afflicted with spatial difficulties, this description serves as a useful guide for navigating to the destination."

"Having been eager to visit this establishment for an extended period of time, I was finally able to fulfill my culinary desire during a recent business excursion. Having sampled numerous purported 'best pizza in the US' venues, including this one, I must admit that while it does not hold the title of the most scrumptious pizza I have had the pleasure of consuming ?a distinction reserved for the likes of Motorino in New York City and A16 in San Francisco ?it undoubtedly boasts an impressive gastronomical experience. The ambiance of the restaurant exudes a unique charm, further enhanced by the exceptional quality of the service provided. Needless to say, I would unhesitatingly return on my next visit to the area."

We visited Tamari on a Friday evening, and owing to the fact that our reservation was rather late (approximately nine o'clock), we were requested to wait for our table for approximately ten minutes due to the restaurant's considerable popularity. The hosts were incredibly cordial and hospitable, and during our brief wait, they kindly offered us drinks from the bar.  

Tamari boasts an extensive array of beverages, encompassing intriguing cocktails and a satisfactory selection of wine and beer.  

I was thoroughly impressed by the imaginative combinations of tapas presented. For the first time in my life, I didn't feel particularly famished. Hence, I opted to sample merely two tapas - specifically, the lamb lollipop and the red snapper. The lamb was remarkably tender and delectable. My fondness for the red snapper, which was served with mussels in a saffron broth, was immense. This dish was uniquely flavored and utterly delicious!  

My companion had the empanadas (which unfortunately did not meet his expectations), but he was thoroughly astounded by both the cost and the caliber of the hangar steak. We presumed the price of $2 to be a jest (or perhaps a typographical error intended to read $20). The steaks (or chicken, bacon, and quail egg, or salmon) come in relatively small portions, of course. Nonetheless, their quality compensates for their modest size!  

Although I have yet to taste the sushi, I am eager to return and experience it. Moreover, I must mention that we spotted Sam Worthington (known for his role in Avatar) at the establishment. My companion insisted that I disclose this information to you, and he further suggested that I augment the rating by half a star in light of Sam's presence. Regrettably, I cannot comply with that request.

"Arrive punctually and avail yourself of the opportunity to secure a seat, as the venue tends to reach capacity rapidly! I hold this cinema in high esteem, as it consistently showcases an array of films that are not commonly accessible elsewhere, thereby offering a unique viewing experience. Spaciousness and comfort are hallmarks of this establishment, but be prepared for a premium price point and a bustling atmosphere, particularly on weekends when parking can prove challenging."

As far as sports bars are concerned, this particular establishment ranks among my favorites, boasting an exceptional ambiance complemented by an abundance of high-quality screens, ensuring that every seat in the house offers an optimal viewing experience. Furthermore, the expansive outdoor patio area constitutes a significant asset, touted as one of the premier bar patios in town, providing an idyllic setting for al fresco dining and socializing. My recent visits to this esteemed venue have coincided with Phoenix Suns playoff games, affording me the opportunity to sample both their diverse selection of delectable appetizers, including but not limited to wings, potato skins, and chicken quesadillas, as well as their prime rib, mashed potatoes, and asparagus dinner option, priced at a remarkably affordable $12. The culinary highlight of my dining experience was undoubtedly the skillet cookie, an indulgent delight that I would unhesitatingly recommend and eagerly anticipate enjoying on future visits. However, minor drawbacks included occasional difficulties in procuring beverages from the waitstaff, but these inconveniences did not detract significantly from the overall enjoyment of my visits, which have left me eager to return and partake in the establishment's offerings on a regular basis.

Easy to enjoy such clean fresh food. This restaurant would be a great addition to any city.  It is wonderful to have restaurant owners who are responding to our community wanting more organic and healthier choices.

"An exceptional venue for indulging in potent potables, we revelled in the merriment of a private gathering, savouring delectable hors d'oeuvres and beverages, with commendations extended to the mixologists for their promptness in concocting libations. The ambiance exuded an air of refined conviviality, further enhanced by the pulsating rhythms that permeated the atmosphere, fostering an idyllic setting for those seeking a more personalised experience than the sprawling nightclubs."

I'm a total fan of the lunch buffet at Villa Antonio! For $9 you get a great meal and of course as much as you want because it's a buffet. One of the best lunch buffets I've been to for a quick lunch during the work day. They have baked chicken, roasted vegetables, salad, mashed potatos, cheese ravioli, and other Italian specialities. You really get your money's worth and more for lunch!

My workplace customarily places an order from Jason's for delivery, but if you're in the mood for an outing, it's certainly worthwhile to visit their establishment in person. While it may be somewhat troublesome to arrive at the venue, their salad bar is truly a remarkable offering. For a mere $7.99, you can indulge in an unrestricted number of trips to their modest yet comprehensive array of fresh ingredients, all while basking in the ambient glow of fluorescent lighting, compliments of the house. Although the salad bar itself may not be particularly extensive, it provides ample sustenance for a satisfying midday repast. Additionally, as an added perk, they offer Captain's Wafers, those nostalgic crackers that evoke memories of childhood. However, it's advisable to steer clear of their outdoor seating area, as it tends to attract vagrants. If you're not interested in procuring an excuse to be less productive, Jason's also offers delivery services for a nominal fee of $3, and I would highly recommend their turkey reuben sandwich. It's exceptionally tasty and, at under 550 calories when paired with baked Lays and a pickle, it's a relatively guilt-free indulgence.

Upon our return home following a four-day sojourn in Las Vegas, we felt compelled to express our profound satisfaction with the exceptional hospitality and culinary delights we experienced at Level 107 on two consecutive evenings, where we savored delectable appetizers and relished the unparalleled quality of their signature martinis, available at a generous two-for-one discount, complemented by a 50% reduction in price for the delectable hors d'oeuvres, which tantalized our taste buds and left us in a state of gastronomic nirvana, prompting us to enthusiastically recommend this esteemed establishment to any individual seeking an atmosphere of conviviality and refined indulgence, where they can indulge in superlative beverages and bask in the attentive and solicitous care of the friendly and competent staff.

A picturesque and inviting breakfast venue in close proximity to our accommodations, where we partook in numerous culinary excursions throughout our two-week sojourn in Brossard. It is advisable to arrive with an unencumbered stomach, as the portions are generously proportioned. A diverse array of delectables, including crepes, waffles, pancakes, omelets, blintzes, and more, graces the menu. Furthermore, complementary coffee is provided with each meal, ensuring that one's cup is perpetually replenished. Notwithstanding, linguistic barriers may exist during weekdays, as the personnel exhibit limited proficiency in English. Nevertheless, the presence of a hospitable hostess and additional staff members during weekend mornings, many of whom possess adequate English skills, mitigates any potential communication difficulties. Perplexingly, certain unfavorable assessments have been documented, perhaps attributable to heightened expectations among local patrons.

There may be other breakfast places that are more unique, have better individual menu items, or are more compelling for one reason or another. But over the years, this place has consistently provided great healthy meals and excellent, fast, friendly service. I have never had a bad experience here and have always left wondering why I don't come back here more often. Then I go and try some new trendy breakfast joint, only to realize I would have been better off coming back to First Watch instead. My personal favorite dish is the Chickichanga, but I've eaten half the stuff on the menu and it's all been really good. And I particularly enjoy the fact that no matter what I eat there, I never feel like I just ingested 9lbs of cheese and grease when I'm done. It's all light and healthy and fantastic.

"A plethora of delectable culinary delights, including an array of freshly baked pastries, assorted breads, and a diverse selection of savory breakfast, lunch, and dinner options, are presented in a welcoming and inviting ambiance, replete with a cozy coffee shop setting, complete with a warm and inviting fireplace, and an abundance of comfortable seating options. Patrons are requested to tender payment at the front counter, after which, attentive staff members will promptly deliver the ordered fare to their tables, allowing them to indulge in a gastronomic experience that is sure to satisfy even the most discerning palate. Additionally, complimentary refills of coffee are offered, ensuring that each visit is nothing short of exceptional. It is virtually impossible to leave this establishment feeling anything less than thoroughly satiated and content."

Having traveled to Peru numerous times, I must say that the food here is equal to or better that what is available in Peru. We went there for lunch and went back to have dinner. The owners and wait staff work very hard so that your dinning experience is well worth a visit. Enjoy!!

My offspring indulged my spouse and me with an excursion to a culinary establishment specializing in Sino-Asian cuisine, commemorating our conjugal union, during the previous month. I must aver that this particular edifice, purveying delectable comestibles of the Far Eastern persuasion, ranks among the more respectable establishments of its ilk within the territorial boundaries of Arizona, owing to my previous residency in the City by the Bay. Although the tariff may be slightly elevated, we did relish the ambient surroundings, proficient hospitality, and gastronomical delights. My quest for an autonomous, meritorious Chinese eatery continues, as I am particularly fond of the dim sum genre.

Awesome place for pho ! Special combination is good,  but there serving is  not consistent sometimes you get a big portion then next time you get a sad face\n :( but this is the only restaurant that serves pho in my area . Service is excellent ! Hope \nThis information is useful :)

"The Chuck Wagon serves as the sole purpose for visiting the Longhorn Casino, as it occupies a considerable area within the establishment, which is entirely justified given its delectable offerings and reasonable pricing. While the culinary selections are diverse, my personal preferences gravitate towards their breakfast menu, specifically The Stampede, comprising an assortment of scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, hash browns, and toast. However, the primary draw of this eatery lies in its exceptional S.O.S., which has garnered the approval of my father, a retired Marine, whose discerning palate serves as a benchmark for gauging the quality of such fare. Although the service at The Chuck Wagon is generally impressive, a single star must be deducted due to the necessity of navigating a smoke-filled casino environment, followed by an inevitable waiting period."

Aw, yeah! I never will go to County Market for my meat shopping again! Old Time can meet almost all of your meat eating needs and they do have a customer appreciation card where you get 10% off your next purchase when you purchase $200 worth at the store. Their sausages are quite good and their special flavors (applewursts you should try for sure!) change but they still have the classic bratwursts and mild and spicy italian sausage. Their flank steak is also good and their bulk italian sausage is also worth your while especially if you make spaghetti sauce from scratch. My complaint is that their hours and location could be better. Their staff is always helpful and they can help with getting special meat cuts.

I've been to Fuzzy's Tacos quite a few times and I've consistently had a good experience.

My go-to favorite for this place is the Taco Plate. You get two tacos and two sides for $6.49 - enough for a decent meal. I've had the veggie tacos and the tempura shrimp tacos, both very good. The chips and salsa are a sizable quantity with no skimping on the salsa.

The burritos are alright, but I suggest to stick towards the tacos. The hot sauce is sufficiently hot. I've been stuck waiting a while for my meal a few times... maybe a suggestion, if anyone at Fuzzy's is watching this: If someone orders chips, maybe they can grab those first while waiting for the other meals to come out?

All in all, a good place to get a few tacos and chips. Lots of TVs so it's good for watching sports. I'd suggest giving it a shot with a couple of your buddies when you get a chance.

"Optimally priced at six dollars, this culinary establishment offers an exceptional gastronomical experience, featuring a delectable burger complemented by the eatery's signature smashed fries and fried pickles, all of which are served in a prompt and amicable manner, thereby providing an overall satisfaction that surpasses that of its competitors, including In N Out, albeit for a slightly higher price point."

"This diminutive wine store is truly remarkable! Despite my limited familiarity with wine consumption, I opted to visit this establishment for a Community Market Youth Employment (CMYE) event. Notably, all the wines sold at this venue are crafted using environmentally responsible and sustainable farming practices, which will undoubtedly appeal to patrons who prioritize ecological awareness. Conveniently situated within the Atherton Market, ample parking facilities are available; however, locating the Vin Master proved to be a bit of a challenge due to its seclusion behind a pizza restaurant and lack of visibility from the main street. Fortunately, conspicuous signs and GPS navigation facilitated its discovery, thereby averting an otherwise unfortunate situation. 

Upon entering the shop, one cannot help but notice the spacious interior, characterized by exposed brick walls, high ceilings, and pleasant illumination, which collectively create a relaxed ambiance. Additionally, the presence of a few chairs and tables allows customers to sample a glass of wine before making a purchase, thereby enhancing their overall experience. Chris, the proprietor, is an incredibly affable and knowledgeable sommelier who will gladly assist clients in selecting an ideal wine suited to their preferences. 

In conclusion, paying a visit to this charming wine store is certainly worthwhile, and it is likely that visitors will depart satisfied with both their encounter and their chosen wine."

Currently closed for renovation, been out last 2 weeks. 

Pricey is kinda subjective , I eat here at lunch and for the price of a "---berto's" plate I get to sit in a nice atmosphere , get  great salsa with  flavor and decent dose of heat 

 So far no complaints with service and I have a  pretty short lunch time. What stops it being great? Well this is a weak four as my meals have been an odd kinda mix  of great   ingredients , prepared consistently well  E.G, salsa, the beans, the rice, the side veggies  are way above most of the fare in similar restaurants  but the protein  comes out a bit bland and is carried by the surrounding material which is a shame.  

If you have friends that think Macoa's  is great this should blow them away:)

"Love that the restaurant places its emphasis on utilizing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients as the foundation of its culinary creations. The ambiance and dcor are equally impressive, fostering a welcoming environment in which to enjoy a meal. The service we received was exceptional; our server ensured that our glasses remained consistently filled, never dipping below the halfway mark. We opted to begin our dining experience with the goat cheese appetizer, which proved to be a delicious choice, particularly when paired with the accompanying beets. My main course selection was the smokey burger, boasting an incredible depth of flavor; however, the texture of the patty was somewhat problematic, as it had a tendency to disintegrate upon handling, making it challenging to consume without a certain degree of dexterity. My spouse chose the sirloin steak, accompanied by sauted mushrooms, and while he praised the rich, savory flavors, he did comment on the chewiness of the cut, as well as the presence of gristle throughout. For our final course, we indulged in the s'mores parfait, which delighted our taste buds with its sweet, chocolatey essence. All things considered, we would undoubtedly revisit this establishment, perhaps opting for the prime rib or a seafood entre on our next visit."

I am compelled to convey my utter bewilderment regarding the events that transpired, as my cognitive faculties were unable to comprehend the unfolding sequence of events, precipitating a state of utter confusion and perplexity; however, I must admit that the visual spectacle presented itself in a manner that was aesthetically pleasing, although I would not consider it feasible to expend financial resources for a subsequent viewing.

I love this pub.  It's real nice and well lit on the inside.  Me and my boys usually come here for their pizza special.  It's half off past 12am so a large pizza would come out to 8 bucks which is not bad because they got some good pizza! Best thin crust I've ever tasted.  

Besides the food and booze, they have a game area with 2 pool tables and some TV's that contain a number of games. Dont know what it actually is tho. I just know it's a touch screen and people play games on it and doesn't have anything to do with gambling.  If you wanna play some music there's a big jukebox where you can choose 2 songs per dollar and has it plays through out the bar.  

It's hidden near Ann and Camino Al Norte across the street from Smith's. And past 10, if you try to open the doors and they're locked, don't worry it's not closed they just gotta buzz you in.

"Newk's has consistently delivered exceptional culinary experiences, with their soups being a particular highlight. In an area saturated with dining establishments, it can be challenging to discover a superior soup option that deviates from the ubiquitous Panera or uninspired greasy chicken noodle variety. However, Newk's offers a plethora of delectable options, including their signature Lobster Bisque, which is a veritable gastronomic masterpiece. Today, I indulged in their Ultimate Lobster Soup, despite my professed aversion to lobster, and was thoroughly impressed by its rich flavors and textures. The Caesar Salad, with its fresh and crunchy lettuce, is also a notable selection, and the addition of a toppings bar allows patrons to customize their dishes according to their preferences. Furthermore, the provision of roasted garlic and other accompaniments such as hot peppers, pickles, capers, Parmesan cheese, and crispy breadsticks serves to enhance the overall dining experience. Of note, the colossal plastic cups provided for fountain drinks at Newk's are equally impressive and practical, capable of containing copious amounts of water or tea, thus obviating the need for frequent refills. These seemingly trivial aspects contribute significantly to the overall satisfaction of a dining excursion, illustrating that even the smallest details can have a profound impact on the enjoyment of a meal."

This place has awesome deals of two for $5 fro-yo or boba!!!  I always get the same, taro milk tea w/ pearls.  They give you a stamp card for everything too!!!  So, every time you buy waffles, crepes, fro-yo, or boba, you get stamped!  They each have their own stamp cards though.  I think its pretty cool how they double stamp you even if you get the two for $5.

I havent had their crepes, but the waffles are delish.  Only downside is that it does take a little while to come out, so if you're in a hurry i'd skip on the savory waffles, and grab something else.  Shaved ice is yum.  I always get the regular one with fro-yo, three toppings of your choice,  shaved ice, and condensed milk. 

I really enjoy coming here and everything i've tried so far is good.  Check it out if you're in the area.

Give me another SinCity burger, please! How delectable it is!  A burger topped with an egg, bacon, and cheese.....drool! Their signature Smash Fries are good, but  not consistent in quality based on the many times we have been there. The salads are not bad either. Just make sure you tell them to put the dressing on the side otherwise your lettuce will be swimming in dressing. Would have been a 5 star, but the inconsistency of the quality of fries and drowning of salad dressing makes it a 4.

"I pursued and completed my Concealed Carry Weapon certification at this esteemed institution, and I must say that the pedagogical proficiency of the educator who facilitated my learning experience was indeed impressive. His extensive expertise in firearm safety and operation was apparent throughout the duration of the course, and his ability to transmute that knowledge into an accessible and practical format for students such as myself was truly commendable. Moreover, his emphasis on precision and accuracy in shooting techniques significantly enhanced my performance, transforming me into a markedly more adept marksman. In conclusion, I cannot help but express my utmost satisfaction with the overall quality of instruction I received, and I would unhesitatingly recommend this establishment to any individual seeking to augment their knowledge and skills in the realm of firearms."

"A particular watering hole in the 'Burgh that I hold in high esteem, due to their extensive selection of draft beers and an array of daily deals that rotate throughout the week. Their menu boasts an assortment of mouthwatering appetizers, juicy burgers, and delectable wings, available for purchase by the pound. Notably, the eatery offers a unique option to buy sauces for their wings, which I find utterly remarkable. For those seeking recommendations, I suggest opting for either the teriyaki or honey BBQ wings, both of which are sure to satiate your taste buds."

"For me, Chick-fil-a represents the epitome of comfort fast food, and my affinity for their culinary offerings is unwavering. The original chicken sandwich, when augmented with a single packet of honey mustard, becomes an unparalleled gustatory experience. Moreover, the delectable waffle fries, which sadly are sometimes provided in meager quantities, are invariably accompanied by an additional honey mustard packet for dipping purposes. It is worth mentioning, however, that on certain Wednesday afternoons, I have had the privilege of witnessing the extraordinary talents of an exceptionally skilled balloon artist at this particular location. This individual's proficiency in creating intricate balloon sculptures has captivated my attention to such an extent that I have been oblivious to both the waiting time and the presence of numerous children, thereby enhancing my overall dining experience. Chick-fil-a's ability to cater to families is yet another aspect that sets them apart from their competitors, as their kids' meals often include educational toys designed to promote literacy."

A quaint, diminutive, and familial eatery that offers an intimate ambiance and serves delectable cuisine, which patrons can either consume on the premises or conveniently obtain through expedited transportation, thereby ensuring a satisfying dining experience that also provides sufficient remnants for a subsequent repast.
Just had steak, bacon & sweet potato tots (& hot sauce!!) for breakfast, Scott had the Hawaiian Breakfast - loved it!!! Soooo good!!

"If you are inclined to indulge in an array of sugary treats and carbonated beverages, this establishment provides an optimal environment for such indulgence. Rocket Fizz offers an extensive selection of unique and nostalgic candies and sodas that are sure to evoke memories of a bygone era. My previous experience with a comparable store in St. George having been satisfactory, I was thrilled to discover a superior iteration here. The Jelly Belly Strawberry Jam soda, in particular, comes highly recommended. The prices are reasonable, the variety of soda and candy options is vast, and the overall ambiance is quite pleasant. I highly endorse Rocket Fizz for those seeking a sweet and fizzy experience."

Got a coupon for a free glitter ball in my email yesterday..so off I go with my little man for a free toy!
Got there and plenty of glitter balls to choose from.
I highly recommend signing up with the email rewards club. They always have events for the kiddos and freebies and great coupons.
I also brought the little guy here when Ozzy Osbourne was signing his new book. it was hella crazy, line around the building. But I managed to take cuts right in front..no one questioned me since I had my baby. We met Ozzy and had a fun time. 
The staff was a bit overwhelmed by the crowd..but they did good.
I always stop here when Im at Town Square.

"Rest in Peace, Chocolate Swan. It is with profound sorrow that we mourn the passing of this esteemed purveyor of delectable confections. For sixteen years, Chocolate Swan graced the culinary scene of Las Vegas's famed Mandalay Bay Resort with an unwavering dedication to excellence, leaving an indelible mark on the palates of its discerning clientele. Their artisanal eclairs and exquisite cakes were the epitome of elegance, earning widespread acclaim and inspiring countless wedding proposals. Alas, the capricious nature of consumer preferences and the relentless evolution of gastronomic trends proved insurmountable adversaries, ultimately claiming the life of this beloved pastry icon. As we bid farewell to Chocolate Swan, our thoughts are with the grieving family and friends who mourn the loss of a true gastronomic artist. May the cherished memories of their sublime creations bring solace in this time of sorrow. In lieu of flowers, donations may be sent to the Mandalay Bay Resort, located at 3950 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, Nevada, 89119. Telephone: (877) 632-7800."

"My affinity for La Condesa is unwavering, primarily due to the extensive array of fresh salsas showcased on their salsa bar, complemented by an impressive diversity of taco options. My culinary exploits at this establishment have encompassed the delectable shrimp, as well as multiple iterations of their steak tacos, each boasting a distinct flavor profile. Furthermore, my experience with their mole chicken has been nothing short of satisfactory. It is worth mentioning that the service here can be somewhat unpredictable, primarily attributable to the eatery's popularity and subsequent bustling atmosphere. Nonetheless, La Condesa remains a stellar dining destination for those in the vicinity."

Went here with some friends for the all you can eat dinner. Pretty cheap compare to other place and the food was good. We got seated as soon as there was a table available. We order our meats and our server was very attentive refilling our drinks and bring more meat as we ordered. Everything was great from the beginning. But beware of smelling like Korean food as you leave!

Over the past fortnight, I have been a regular patron at this specific PetSmart establishment, indulging in an array of canine delights, including delectable treats, premium dog food, and an assortment of playthings. My new puppy, Howie, has been relishing the gourmet BLUE BUFFALO cuisine, which boasts a unique blend of nutritious ingredients, excluding soy, gluten, corn, and meat byproducts. While the cost may be slightly elevated, I rationalize that investing in Howie's healthy sustenance is analogous to my own commitment to consuming wholesome fare.
