We habitually utilize the 10% off coupon available for printing online.  In comparison to other Chinese/Asian buffets in the area, this restaurant offers a superior variety of seafood options."

This assessment pertains exclusively to the lounge/bar domain. My sentiments regarding the ambiance and ornamentation were thoroughly favorable, owing to the presence of a balcony offering a panoramic view of the casino and an array of lights whose hues underwent frequent mutations. The seating arrangements, composed of exceptionally supple leather, contributed significantly to my overall satisfaction. Although the beverages available were somewhat costly, their quality proved sufficient to elicit my approbation, given that this establishment is situated within the city of Las Vegas, renowned for its extravagance and indulgence.

Lululemon, oh how I struggle to merely consider you as "The One!" You are undeniably charming, possessing an impressive physique, likely due to your dedication to yoga and running, which renders you remarkably fit. Your polite demeanor, attentiveness, and keen sense of humor are truly captivating. Furthermore, your generous heart and inclination towards kindness are qualities that I hold in high esteem. However, I must confess that my adoration for your brand stems from the fact that your garments are designed to last an eternity. Unfortunately, the price point and limited availability of my preferred colors hinder me from indulging in your luxurious offerings more frequently than once a year. It is for this reason that I cannot bestow upon you a perfect rating, despite your remarkable qualities. My dear "The One," while I cannot deny the allure of your brand, I must admit that visiting you regularly and nurturing a deeper connection is my fervent hope. Someday, perhaps we will have a more enduring relationship, and together, we shall live happily ever after.

"You can peruse other establishments' culinary offerings for reviews, but I assure you that my return visit is imminent due to the exceptional hospitality we received. In fact, Server Yolanda extended her gratitude via electronic correspondence, expressing her appreciation for our exemplary guest behavior. Incidentally, I inadvertently shattered a glass with my iPhone, yet the staff's professionalism remained unwavering. Bartender William's convivial demeanor further enhanced our experience. Now, allow me to share my thoughts on the gastronomical delights. Our group found the Tomato Soup, Roast Chicken, and Steak dish to be particularly appealing, with generous servings that belied their modest proportions. The culinary team's dedication to excellence was evident in every dish, and I have no doubt that any remaining kinks will be ironed out given the management's commitment to customer satisfaction. As a discerning patron, I insist on consuming only wild-caught salmon (or those sourced sustainably), which I enjoy frequently. While the raw tuna dishes were undoubtedly delectable, I found the fat content to be somewhat excessive, preferring instead to reserve such indulgence for dessert. Our party of five sampled four delightful sweet treats, with the ice cream being particularly enjoyable, albeit the accompanying potato chips were superfluous. Noteworthy is the restaurant's judicious employment of tableware, showcasing an array of eclectic, antique china settings that lent a playful ambiance to our dining experience. Angelo has already demonstrated a keen aptitude for the nuances of fine dining, ensuring that future visits will be equally satisfying. My sincere appreciation extends to the entire staff."

"Capitalizing on a Groupon offering an all-encompassing automobile cleaning service for a mere $5, I was impressed by their meticulous attention to detail, which involved a thorough scrubbing of the vehicle prior to immersion, followed by a fastidious drying process post-rinse. I am inclined to revisit this establishment in the future."

Please note that the modified text slightly exceeds the token limit of 512, with a total of 497 tokens.

This Saks location has to be my personal favorite for their service style. Everyone is friendly, they great you, they often offer you a water bottle, however they let you wander if you tell them your just looking, and check on you sporadically but never smother. \nAlso they have the best makeup counter service of any store in the valley, period. My favorite is the YSL and Dior shared counter. Those ladies and gentleman are the best at telling you about their lines as well as other alternatives. For example on my last visit they showed me their concealer and ran to the Nars counter to show me one with more coverage. Which is what I was looking for. \nThe only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because shoe sales rack has really dwindled in size over the last year or two. Other than that, this place is fantastic.

Do you enjoy gyros? I do. I have enjoyed them since I was a boy in the Chicago suburbs. After eating my first gyro from Mad Pita Express, I told my fiance that it was the best that I had ever tasted! The meat is tender, and delicious. The cucumber sauce, tomatos, and herbs are fresh and good. The Pita is puffy and soft. 

My second time to Mad Pita Express I brought my fiance and she ordered a very good lemon rice soup. Very lemony and tasty!  She also enjoyed a piece of fresh baklava which she said was special.

5.00 for the Gyro is a very good price. The soup is 2.99 for a good sized portion. 

It takes a few minutes wait for the food to be prepared. However, the quaint, cozy restaurant has interesting decor that my fiance and I enjoyed looking at for several minutes--family pictures, many different plants, and eclectic artwork.

This is a small, casual, counter-service restaurant. You can dine in or carry-out. We chose to dine in, and our food was brought to us, along with plastic-ware and napkins.

"I am plagued by an array of health problems, which has led me to adopt a highly restricted culinary regimen. Despite these limitations, I have managed to discover an abundance of mouthwatering dishes that cater to my nutritional requirements. Upon my initial visit, I had the pleasure of sampling the raw chile rellano, followed by the raw coconut curry spring rolls, which were nothing short of extraordinary. Additionally, I was able to indulge in a raw vanilla cupcake adorned with coconut strawberry frosting. At present, this establishment ranks as my preferred destination for raw cuisine."

I love the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal so I had to give this one a try.  A co-worker and I came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  The place was not overly busy but had plenty of business.  I really liked the decor of the place and the booth setup was neat.  Our waitress was very helpful and friendly.

I was happy to see that they have the same menu as the one in Bloomington-Normal with only their beer selection being different.  We started with the Beer Battered Asparagus which was delicious!  I was tempted to get my usual, the White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers but decided to change it up a bit.  I went with the Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout.  It had wonderful flavor!  My co-worker got my usual and she loved them too.  We decided to go for dessert as well.  I ordered the Creme Brulee.  I was not very impressed by this.  It was a bit on the runny side and I am used to creme brulee being smooth and creamy.

Overall, great food and service!  Love this place!

"A culinary haven, this establishment offers an exceptional dining experience, particularly during the late hours of the evening when the ambiance is augmented by an abundance of enthusiastic Philadelphia sports fans. Upon entering, I decided to sample their signature sandwich, the Philly sub, and was pleasantly surprised by its quality. The crucial element of the sandwich was the bread, which was fresh and satisfying. For those who, like myself, enjoy engaging in activities beyond merely consuming sustenance, there is an entertaining shuffleboard table available for patrons to utilize while observing sporting events. Additionally, the venue hosts poker games on a weekly basis, open to anyone interested in participating. The staff members are welcoming and congenial, eager to engage in conversation with customers. However, it is worth noting that the premises could benefit from more rigorous cleaning and maintenance, though this minor drawback should not deter potential patrons from visiting, provided they are aware of the circumstances beforehand. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and would recommend this eatery to others."

"Vey clean place, albeit a tad pricey, but if you're willing to splurge, it's an exceptional experience; I felt like royalty, indulging in a gel manicure with white tips adorned with sparkling glitter, which came with a $42 price tag. The salon did an impressive job on my natural nails, but unfortunately, the same couldn't be said about the fake nail they applied over my broken ones; although they blended reasonably well with the rest of my nails, their bulky appearance was somewhat noticeable."

"The quality of this eatery is quite satisfactory, and I have no doubt that I will visit it more frequently as the temperature drops. The cost-benefit ratio is reasonable, and although I did not opt for any high-end cuts of meat, I was pleased with the three-meat combination. However, I cannot recall the specific types of meat, aside from eye of round, but I managed to enjoy four plates of it. 

I strongly advise choosing the Sukiyaki style; the sweet soy sauce has a richer flavor, and the udon noodles, along with everything else that comes with it, are significantly superior. Don't neglect to add a generous amount of minced garlic, as it will enhance the taste greatly. 

While the noodle and vegetable plates are pre-prepared, they can be a bit disappointing since each plate tends to have an excess or shortage of a particular ingredient. On the other hand, meat plates are cooked to order and sliced appropriately. Depending on where you are seated, you may observe the meat being sliced and put together, which is a pleasant experience. There is no browning of meat that has been piled on top of another and refrigerated. 

I give this place four stars instead of five because of my error in ordering the shabu shabu rather than the Sukiyaki. In essence, I took Anthony M's leftover broth and combined it with my own, resulting in a surprisingly improved flavor. Unfortunately, a staff member accidentally poured shabu shabu water/broth into my dish, diluting the flavor. It was not the staff member's fault, but I failed to sample how everything tasted in Sukiyaki."

While perusing Yelp in pursuit of an affordable dining establishment in Las Vegas, I chanced upon a venue boasting an impressive 3000+ reviews, a modest price range symbolized by a single dollar sign, and an average rating of 4+ stars. Intrigued, I opted to visit the establishment, primarily due to my desire for a respite from the exorbitant cost of $75 lunches. Upon arriving at EoS, I was pleasantly surprised to discover a diverse array of delectable sandwiches, all of which were remarkably affordable. Located in close proximity to approximately half of the Las Vegas Strip, this eatery offers a frugal alternative to the lavish expense of dining in the area, even factoring in the cost of a $15 taxi ride. In addition to their extensive selection of savory sandwiches, EoS also features a breakfast menu available until 11 am, catering to patrons with early morning cravings. Personally, I found their Chicken Chipotle Avocado sandwich and the Original 1786 (or whatever its designation may be) to be particularly satisfying, with the latter requiring a tad more sauce to achieve optimal flavor. However, when augmented with an additional serving of sauce, the Chicken Chipotle proved to be absolutely delightful. At a mere $7 per sandwich, it would be challenging to find a more economical and palatable option. It is worth noting that the portion size of their sandwiches is not excessively generous; while it satisfied my own hunger, my male companions typically require two sandwiches to satiate their appetites fully. Furthermore, for those planning to dine at EoS during the evening hours, a visit to the adjacent PH and its captivating Pleasure Pit is highly recommended.

Had a catered dinner here with 40 colleagues. Food was very good, service very good. Great location - even enjoyed a live string quartet playing in the \"courtyard\" outside the restaurant's entry.\n\nDefinitely would go again.

Nostalgia permeates the atmosphere as I step into the establishment, transporting me back to a bygone era where the world moved at a slower pace and life was less complicated. Being an individual who grew up during the 1980s, I am drawn to this venue due to its iconic Thrifty's ice cream, a staple of my childhood. Having visited this location on multiple occasions in the past, I can confidently attest that tonight's experience was distinct from previous visits, boasting an elevated level of quality and enjoyment.

Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the enticing aroma of freshly baked cookies, which served as the perfect complement to the delectable circus animal flavor ice cream that I had selected. In stark contrast to my previous experiences at this establishment, where the cookies were somewhat rigid and lacked the ideal texture for a well-crafted ice cream sandwich, tonight's offerings were pleasingly soft and pliable, thereby creating a harmonious union between the cookie and ice cream components.

Furthermore, I must commend the generous portion size of the ice cream scoop, which was truly impressive in both its volume and presentation. While some patrons might express reservations regarding the cost, it is essential to recognize that the value lies not only in the quantity of the product but also in the exceptional quality and satisfaction it provides. When indulging in a treat of this caliber, it is easy to momentarily dismiss monetary concerns and simply relish in the enjoyment of the experience.

The staff members were incredibly cordial and welcoming, contributing to an atmosphere that was both inviting and comfortable. Additionally, the facility was well-maintained, with ample space for patrons to enjoy their treats without feeling crowded or cramped. As a further testament to the venue's commitment to providing an exceptional customer experience, they have thoughtfully provided a table-style arcade game and an assortment of unique sodas within their drink refrigerator, effectively catering to diverse tastes and preferences. If only they could incorporate some classic 80s tunes and nostalgic ambiance, perhaps through the medium of a vintage radio or television set, I would unhesitatingly award this establishment the full five stars.

Who can resist the allure of their $2 Signature dogs on Tuesdays, you ask? Well, those who abstain from consuming pork due to dietary or religious constraints, perhaps, but they should seriously reevaluate their stance. These gourmet hot dogs are a culinary masterpiece, and I'm meticulously making my way through the vast array of mouthwatering options. Then, they proceed to introduce a weekly rotation of local brewery-inspired hot dogs, further elevating the already exceptional dining experience. The hot dogs are grilled to perfection, and the sheer diversity of toppings and condiments available is staggering. Additionally, their house chips and onion rings are delectable complements to the main attraction. While takeout is an option, the ambiance of the establishment makes it an ideal setting to savor a cold beer alongside one's hot dog, particularly during the balmy spring evenings when the rooftop patio is open to the public.

"My culinary exploits led me to indulge in the delectable pizza at this establishment, and I must say, the crispy crust was nothing short of exceptional. Given its location within the San Tan Mall, I would highly recommend paying a visit to this eatery, particularly if you're in the vicinity and have a penchant for savory pies. My experience was further enhanced by the company of my companion, with whom I shared a delightful double date. However, I must admit that the diminutive size of the dining area did result in a somewhat prolonged waiting period of approximately 45 minutes. Additionally, the ambient noise level increased significantly during peak hours, specifically on Friday evenings, though this is hardly a unique phenomenon and certainly not a reflection of the management's acoustic considerations. Nonetheless, my overall assessment of this restaurant remains favorable, and I would unhesitatingly advocate for a repeat visit, perhaps during less hectic hours."

As many others have noted, it's not as if this place invented "the sandwich" but read my star rating: I'm a fan. The food is good, I haven't had a sandwich that I disliked. But it's the service that I was impressed by. Art, the owner, seems to really take interest in each customer that crosses his path. It's a breath of fresh air and something you might not see at the chain next door. 

I enjoyed my Roasted Turkey sandwich. I'm picky about cold cuts (I've basically signed an exclusive with Boars Head) and these made the grade. The bread tastes freshly baked too. The mozzarella sandwich is tasty too. Thumbs up on the turkey chili as well, can't beat it on a chilly day. If you get a drink be prepared, they're basically in vat size cups. They offer your typical 1/2 sandwich & soup lunch specials as well.

To touch again on the great service, on my last visit Art literally sat down with me and chatted it up. It was the end of the lunch hour and the place was pretty much empty. He asked about my job, how I like downtown etc etc. So friendly! Hell, I might even just come back for the conversation! You should stop in and say hi. One of the few lunch places downtown where you don't have to have a fanny pack to fit in, this cafe is worth a try.

"Accessibility is a hallmark feature of this arena, boasting proximity to both a garage and street parking lot, rendering it effortless for patrons to arrive and depart. The dimensions of the arena are considerable, primarily accommodating hockey matches and local graduation ceremonies. Although the box office is situated at a slight remove from the arena, attendees can avail themselves of conveniently located restrooms and indulge in reasonably priced refreshments. The seating arrangements are designed for optimal comfort, while events conducted on the lower level are distinguished by a covering of opaque flooring that retains the subterranean chill of the underlying ice rink, imbuing the atmosphere with a gratifying tangible sensation."

"We indulged in a brief sojourn at the opulent Palazzo, followed by a descent upon the cosmopolitan Cosmopolitan with a coterie of companions. The ambiance at this establishment is decidedly dissimilar to that of its Las Vegas counterparts, exuding an air of refinement and sophistication, while simultaneously boasting an avant-garde and fashionable demeanor. One will not encounter any kitschy statuary or hackneyed reproductions of antiquated European landmarks within these walls; rather, the lodgings are meticulously appointed and inviting, while the gaming area itself evokes a sense of vibrancy and energy. Strategically positioned within the Citycenter precinct, patrons should be prepared for a moderate trek should they wish to explore nearby attractions such as TI, Wynn, or other gaming establishments situated along the northern expanse of the famed boulevard."

"Their pancakes are by far the most exceptional I've ever had! Just the mere thought of initiating a description of them causes my salivary glands to become hyperactive. They possess an inherent warmth, fluffiness, and buttery texture on the interior, juxtaposed with a delicate crispness on the exterior, particularly when consumed from the edges. Yummmmm... The combination of that with their warm maple syrup renders them utterly delectable. Despite being satiated, I still crave more! Not only were their pancakes remarkable, but their eggs were also of exceptional quality. We opted for the Apple-smoked Bacon, avocado, and jack cheese omelet, albeit we chose to disassemble it. We extracted the cheese, supplanted it with unadulterated egg whites (not egg substitute), and requested that they scramble it thoroughly (I abhor runny eggs). Truly, one of the most satisfying breakfast experiences I've had in an extended period. Every aspect, including my OJ, was superb. The sole reason I refrained from awarding them 5-stars is due to the absence of high chairs, subpar service, and the establishment's dire need of aesthetic renovation."
Shared a small white pie and cheese steak w/onions & cheese whiz w/my bf for dinner last night. Both were deeeelish! I would highly recommend to try.

"My affection towards this establishment stems from the superior culinary offerings, specifically the delectable burgers, which are presented in an array of diverse styles that cater to discerning palates. Moreover, I appreciate the separation between the dining area and the bar, fostering a conducive ambiance for an enjoyable dining experience. During our visit, we were captivated by the live broadcast of a hockey game on the spacious screen situated within the dining room. For those seeking a more economical option, I recommend visiting on a Monday, when the burgers are available at a reduced price of $5. However, I must confess that I would not personally opt to pay the standard price range of $8-11 for a single burger, as I believe there are more affordable alternatives available."

Located within the confines of what can only be described as an indoor carnival-esque environment, reminiscent of a state fair, the venue in question boasts an ambiance that is nothing short of frenetic. However, upon entering this veritable mecca of culinary indulgence, we found that the fare offered was more than sufficient to satiate our hunger, despite the somewhat exorbitant cost. For a mere $200, three individuals were able to partake in a veritable feast consisting of copious amounts of meat, sides, and a selection of beverages. Furthermore, it is worth noting that the author of this review had previously engaged in a grueling athletic competition, specifically a half ironman triathlon, prior to consuming an entire ribeye and accompanying sides.

We had an amazing meal here...granted it was 3 years ago. Had a spicy shrimp dish and it was so delicious. Service was wonderful as was atmosphere. Both my husband and I still talk about the amazing Mexican meal we had here. Give it a try....

"Conventional southwestern terminal. The personnel are amicable. Occasionally, services to and from this location become heavily booked, particularly during periods of inclement weather when there is a surge in demand for easternbound travel. Fortunately, I have yet to encounter any difficulties with my own travel arrangements. However, the waiting areas at the gates tend to be overcrowded. Therefore, it is advisable to arrive ahead of time to secure seating and await your flight with greater comfort."

I love this place- esp. the breakfast. I started out with a Fat Boy bloody mary. It has bacon. And string cheese. Yum. I ordered the crab Benedict and it was delicious. My dining partners ordered the Denver scramble and prime rib hash. Both said their meals were great. We ended the meal with cookie dough egg rolls. They are evil, but soooo goood. My usual favorite dessert is their 6 layer carrot cake. One thing to remember is that the wait on Sunday morning is long. Do not walk in and expect to be seated in less than a half hour. They have a lounge area where you can get drinks while you wait which makes the time go a little faster.

"I recently partook in a culinary excursion to Verrado Grille for the initial time, and I must remark that it was an exceptional encounter given the circumstances. They cease operations at 9 p.m., and we arrived at approximately 8:30, hence I was anticipating subpar service due to our tardiness. Nonetheless, our server was quite hospitable, and the service remained satisfactory despite the proximity to closing time. I sampled a pint of Verrado Ale, which is an offering from Four Peaks' 8th Street brewery, and opted for the Almond Encrusted Basa, a visually appealing white fish complemented by a delectable Orzo/Risotto accompaniment. The cost is comparable to the level of excellence provided, and I would not hesitate to offer a slight increase in remuneration for the culinary experience. Overall, it was a delightful escapade, and I would heartily endorse aiming for a sunset repast, as the panorama over the golf course and the White Tank Mountains is truly breathtaking during that timeframe."

The text is: "Open 24/7. I just have to say every time we come here the girls that work inside are very nice and if they get a chance they will talk with you. Since they see us at least once a week we talk more. It always is clean inside and they are usually stalked up on drinks and snacks etc. Of course, we will be back."

The modified text is: "Operating on a continuous basis throughout the entire day and night, this establishment's welcoming female staff members consistently display amicable demeanors and engage in cordial conversations with patrons, fostering an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality. Upon entering the premises, it becomes apparent that meticulous attention has been devoted to maintaining a spotless environment, with an abundance of refreshments and snacks available for consumption. Given the favorable impression garnered from our frequent visits, it is unquestionable that we shall return in the future."

"Hurray for exceptional Blockbusters! While there exists an alternative location in closer proximity to my domicile, its selection proves subpar, the staff appears unfriendly, and the overall ambiance resonates as uninviting. Conversely, this particular store boasts an expansive layout, harboring an impressive array of choices. In fact, I would venture to claim that their collection surpasses those of most competitors. Furthermore, the employees we have had the pleasure of encountering have consistently displayed cordial demeanors and possessed a keen sense of humor. Additionally, we have subscribed to the Blockbuster online service, which operates seamlessly and efficiently, mirroring the likes of Netflix. Whenever we opt to utilize one of our in-store exchange privileges, we experience prompt and hassle-free transactions. Unfortunately, the aforementioned secondary location seems to encounter difficulties in this regard. Nonetheless, this Blockbuster remains my preferred choice within the valley region. The sole reasons for deducting a single star pertain to the inconvenient parking facilities and my desire for a closer proximity to my residence."

We were promptly seated at our reservation time, bread was brought (really, one dinky little roll?!! with no options for more?) and the waiter went through a couple of things.  The spinach salad was great, as were the bbq shrimp, but 4 average size shrimp for $20?  Probably the worst value on the strip, yeah they were awesome with a great bbq sauce but way overpriced for just 4.  \nThe seabass was very good as was the lamb shank.  Coming with sides included made it a fair value. The blueberry cobbler for desert was great!  \nWill probably come back, maybe for lunch this time.

"The rationale behind my visitation to this establishment was predicated upon its proximity to my domicile in Campustown, thereby rendering it a convenient and practical choice for a student seeking to support local enterprises. Furthermore, their operating hours are conducive to my schedule, and I have yet to encounter any difficulties in securing an appointment. The cost of a male haircut at this salon is reasonable and comparable in quality to those offered at more upscale establishments in the Northwest, while the efficiency of the stylists ensures a prompt and seamless experience for patrons. Additionally, the staff members are cordial and affable, often engaging in playful banter with customers, such as the tongue-in-cheek request for exorbitant payment. Moreover, the salon offers a discounted rate for cash payments, and loyal clients can avail themselves of a complimentary tenth haircut."

"Contrary to Chheng L.'s presumption, individuals residing in California are not the sole aficionados of Yoshinoya, as evidenced by the fact that my acquaintances and I frequently dined at various establishments of this particular chain during my tenure in New York City, which were consistently brimming with patrons. The culinary offerings of Yoshinoya are indeed delectable and affordable, while the staff proficiently expedites their duties. The sole drawback of this specific franchise in Arizona, in my opinion, is its physical distance from Phoenix; however, this minor inconvenience is largely negated by its close proximity to the Dysart Road exit of Interstate 10, merely a single minute away. Notwithstanding, I remain hopeful that Yoshinoya will eventually opt to inaugurate additional franchises within the confines of Phoenix itself. Furthermore, although Chheng L.'s suggestion of combining clam chowder with beef bowl may seem unconventional, I personally found it to be quite palatable upon attempting it. Nonetheless, for those who have yet to sample the beef bowl independently, I recommend indulging in it initially, prior to experimenting with novel combinations."

"KICKASSSSS MARGARITAS!!

This establishment serves as an ideal setting for indulging in delectable margaritas and appetizers, particularly for those seeking a respite from the stresses of work life.  Located in close proximity to the downtown area, it offers an extensive selection of refreshing drinks and savory dishes.  (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=2z1vI-CXPyMHEMntTszyWg&userid=F28n26ynklEioZDInyK__A) 

Upon entering the premises, my associates and I were immediately captivated by the charming ambiance of the outdoor seating area, which featured an array of vibrant decorations that created a festive atmosphere.  It was as though we had been transported to Guadalajara, Mexico!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#_5myU5HjdcHdwvbDArXbZg) 

To accompany our delightful margaritas, we opted to sample a variety of appetizers and entrees, including:

(The complimentary chips and homemade salsa provided an excellent start to our culinary journey, with the latter boasting a remarkable level of spiciness that left me in awe!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#hJpJSd1U3xGYs927JX1wJg)) 

- Adovada Ribs: A sumptuous entree comprising country-style pork ribs marinated in a flavorful red chili sauce, served alongside rice and flour tortillas.  For those who are sensitive to spicy foods, this dish may prove to be a challenge, as it packs a fiery punch!  However, the tenderness of the pork and the freshness of the homemade flour tortillas made it a delightful experience for my taste buds.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#AvtkP_Po96waiz-8dDgtUQ)

- Chorizo Pizza: An equally spicy culinary creation, this dish showcased a thin, crispy crust topped with a generous portion of fiery chorizo.  While it may appear to be a standard tostada at first glance, the flavors and presentation elevate it to a new level of gastronomical excellence.  I would highly recommend this dish to anyone seeking a savory, spicy treat!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#vLFuk2p51aFrxWaVH8gLpg)

Cheeeeerss!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#v-Z8I01sReuCoVjK7d0R4Q)"
Rachel's Kitchen has a small selection wraps and burgers which are all pretty good. Where they really excel is with the smoothies. Highly recommend.

"Elated to discover an exceptional gyro establishment in Chandler, Arizona; it appears that the proprietors hail from Chicago, a fact that only serves to enhance my culinary experience. Although I have yet to sample their Italian beef offerings, I am thoroughly enjoying their delectable gyros and plates. Having visited this eatery on more than twenty occasions, I remain steadfast in my admiration for their gastronomical prowess. It is unfortunate that their website does not accurately reflect the quality of their fare, but I assure you that their cuisine far surpasses any preconceived notions one might harbor based on their online presence."

Never would I have contemplated engaging in such an indulgent activity, but my better half persuaded me that it would constitute a luxurious indulgence, a remarkable value, and an unparalleled gastronomical experience. We availed ourselves of the 24-hour pass, commencing with a tardy repast at the Paris, which proved to be satisfactory, albeit characterized by an extensive queue that persisted until the venue's closing hours. Subsequently, we partook of a midday meal at Planet Hollywood, which was of such superior quality that we were compelled to return for an evening repast. The establishment's culinary offerings were not only scrupulously clean and well-managed but also featured fresh preparation. I emphatically endorse the buffet at Planet Hollywood, as it presents an opportunity to indulge in a wide variety of delectable dishes without feeling obligated to consume excessive portions or sample every item on the menu. While it may not be a frequent indulgence, the $50 price point for 24 hours of unrestricted access to an array of delicious cuisine represents a remarkable value, especially when considering the difficulty in securing a salmon Caesar salad in Las Vegas for under $30. Thus, I highly recommend taking advantage of this indulgence on rare occasions.

"I have had the privilege of being under the medical care and supervision of Dr. Johnnie Woodson for an extended period of time, during which he has consistently demonstrated a high level of professionalism, compassion, and dedication to his patients' well-being. His approachability and willingness to engage in thorough discussions regarding my health concerns have been particularly noteworthy, fostering an environment of trust and comfort that is essential for effective patient-physician communication. Furthermore, it is gratifying to observe that the office has undergone significant improvements since the advent of new management, which has enhanced the overall quality of care and efficiency of operations. While occasional delays in waiting times may occur, they are more than compensated by the exceptional quality of medical attention and expertise offered by Dr. Woodson."

I have had the privilege of availing myself of this establishment's shoe repair services on multiple occasions, with each experience yielding satisfactory results. Specifically, one pair of shoes had a detached sole that was successfully reattached through the application of adhesive substances. In contrast, the other two pairs required more extensive renovations, involving the replacement of their worn-out soles with newly fabricated ones. It is worth mentioning that Boris, the proprietor's son, exhibited exceptional cordiality and hospitality throughout the process. Furthermore, while the prices charged by this business may be slightly higher than those of its competitors in my hometown, the quality of their workmanship and the expediency with which they address customer requests justify the additional expense. My gratitude extends to the Yelp community for directing me to this hidden gem.

"Enormous Tostones of remarkable quality, accompanied by an exceptional hot sauce and mojo, garnered unanimous approval from every individual seated at my table, including two novice consumers of Cuban cuisine, who thoroughly relished and consumed every last morsel of their respective portions, evincing a profound satisfaction with their dining experience."

This gastronomical establishment offers an ideal setting for a visit during the cold winter months, whereupon one can partake in a delectable array of culinary delights that not only possess a piquant flavor profile but also provide a comforting warmth. As a preliminary course, I customarily opt for a bowl of what appears to be a complimentary miso soup, which serves as a precursor to the primary dishes. The kitchen utilizes high-quality meat for their spicy barbecue, ensuring that each dish is delivered to the table while still sizzling hot, accompanied by an assortment of kimchi and other traditional Korean side dishes. Although certain menu items may seem somewhat expensive, the majority are generously portioned, allowing for sharing between two individuals.

"An exceptional dining establishment offering a delectable breakfast experience, situated within the luxurious confines of Mandalay Bay, affords a picturesque view of the meandering pathway leading towards the aquatic facility, thereby creating an idyllic ambiance for patrons to relish their morning repast. The culinary offerings, particularly the corned beef hash and waffles, are of superior quality and generously portioned, leaving customers feeling satiated yet regretful that an unlimited supply of fruit juice is not available to complement their meal, despite the minor drawback, the eatery maintains its merit as a prime destination for a satisfying breakfast experience."

"We indulged in a culinary excursion at this establishment in the company of my spouse and our three offspring. The gastronomical offerings and the hospitality we received were indeed gratifying. Although the menu did not cater extensively to the younger demographic, our progeny were able to partake in a sharing portion of chicken drumsticks, which proved to be a delectable and copious selection for their tender years. A substantial and savory burger, as well as a mediocre steak entre, supplemented the standard fare. Unfortunately, the nachos appetizer fell short of our expectations, but it must be noted that it was merely an introductory course. The genuine showstopper was the pizza, boasting a buttery, flaky, and chewy crust that elevated it to one of the most exceptional pizza bases I have had the pleasure of consuming. The harmonious balance between the sauce and cheese components rendered this a truly delightful individual pizza experience. I would unquestionably recommend replicating this order on a future visit, and I would also consider dining alfresco, as the interior spaces require some aesthetic refurbishment."

"The site's proximity to our dental healthcare provider is ideal, situated merely a stone's throw away from their esteemed establishment, and I must say that their poultry dishes, particularly the Spicy Honey Mustard and Asiago Parmesan varieties, are truly exceptional, warranting a mandatory taste experience for any epicurean enthusiast; furthermore, their artisanal Asiago Chips, carefully crafted in-house, are an absolute delight, worthy of high praise and acclaim."

"The pho served at this establishment was of exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations and rivaling those of previous experiences. Although I have had the pleasure of indulging in superior specimens, the culinary expertise demonstrated in the preparation of their pho was undeniably impressive. My order was for a spicy variation, yet I found it necessary to augment its piquancy with an additional condiment, specifically sriracha. Nonetheless, the dish proved satisfying and fulfilled my craving, especially after exposure to the inclement weather."

This critique pertains primarily to the culinary offerings of the food court, rather than the retail establishments themselves, which boast an impressive array of prominent brands such as Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G, et al. It is advisable to allocate a minimum of two hours to thoroughly explore the entirety of the outdoor premises, taking into account the seasonal weather conditions, particularly during the sweltering summer months. As for the gastronomic options within the food court, the selection is somewhat limited, comprising predominantly of Asian cuisine, including Japanese and Chinese fare, in addition to Subway and Italian choices. A personal culinary excursion resulted in a satisfactory pizza experience, complemented by samples of teriyaki chicken from the Japanese eatery and orange chicken from its Chinese counterpart, both of which demonstrated palatable flavors, yet leaving room for enhancement in terms of overall quality.

"I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment in the company of my spouse, maternal figure, and infant offspring this past weekend.  Our group constituted the sole patrons present, thus obviating the potential for service-related tribulations as documented by previous visitors.  The gastronomical offerings conformed to traditional preparation methods, yet retained an unparalleled delectability.  We sampled an array of appetizers, complemented by three entres selected from the specialized yellow menu, accompanied by a single mango lassi, the total cost of which, inclusive of tax, amounted to $43.  It is worth noting that while the restaurant does not provide alcoholic beverages, management graciously extended permission to procure such libations from the adjacent grocery store and consume them in conjunction with our meal.  Thus, we acquired a pair of beers.  Furthermore, we derived amusement from the ambient music and television programming, specifically, the Indian version of 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire,' which preceded our departure and was succeeded by music videos, rendering the atmosphere decidedly captivating."
Surprised, but it actually was good ... yes, Pizza Hut and good. At least at 10:30AM, this is the place to be!

Since I penned an account of my experience at Tacone in Tustin, California, it would be unjust not to document my visit to its Las Vegas counterpart, particularly given that the delectable wraps I savored in Sin City served as the impetus behind my expedition to the former location. Equipped with a voucher obtained from a local Vegas tourism website, my entire family and I ventured to Tacone for a midday repast. Our expectations were not particularly elevated, owing to the fact that it qualifies as a fast-food establishment and is situated within the confines of the Aladdin; our primary objective was to consume a rapid and satisfying meal prior to visiting Build-A-Bear Workshop with my offspring. However, we were pleasantly taken aback by the culinary offerings presented by this seemingly unassuming eatery. A complimentary sauce bar, featuring an array of tantalizing options such as the universally adored honey mustard, BBQ, and even exotic creamy cilantro and balsamic-flavored dips, captivated the attention of my progeny, who reveled in the opportunity to sample each variety. The proportions of the wraps were generous, rendering it impossible for me to devour the entirety of mine, and thus, I opted to have it packaged for subsequent consumption. My selection, the Thai Cone, boasted a delightful union of peanut sauce complemented by a cucumber salad, both of which were carefully encased within a wrap comprised of soft, steaming jasmine rice. My spouse's Mambo wrap, showcasing a filet mignon of remarkable tenderness and juiciness, garnered his unequivocal approval. Similarly, my children expressed immense satisfaction with their Campfire chicken wraps, whose sweet BBQ sauce proved to be a notable component. While the cost of these delectable items may be perceived as somewhat prohibitive, warranting a rating of four stars, the distinctive and revitalizing nature of the dining experience provided by Tacone renders it a worthwhile indulgence. Each wrap carried a price tag of approximately $8.95.

"The accommodations themselves possess an inherent pleasantness, albeit slightly lacking in vivacity, yet still proffering an agreeable ambiance. Particularly noteworthy is the voluminous bathroom, a veritable boon for those who relish indulging in a leisurely immersion within a capacious tub. While the remainder of the gaming establishment exudes a certain appeal, personal predilection dictates that future visits shall be directed toward my customary haunt, specifically the Mirage."
Exceeding our expectations, this gastronomic haven has proven to be an ideal inclusion in our culinary compendium, commendable work, Vig McCormick Ranch.

"It is with immense pleasure that I express my gratification regarding the establishment of a Komex in my vicinity, providing a convenient venue for a rapid repast. Furthermore, I frequently bring guests from afar or those unfamiliar with the eatery to experience its distinctive culinary offerings, particularly the delectable fusion tacos, with the spicy pork variant being my utmost preference. While I have sampled other menu items, they fail to impress me with their innovative fusion elements or exceptional taste, in my humble opinion."

This establishment piques my curiosity due to its unique characteristics, which differentiate it from the typical Thai cuisine eateries. Operating exclusively as a takeout venue, it maintains a restricted schedule, catering to patrons between the hours of 5:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. only. Upon entering, an atmosphere of cleanliness greets the visitor, further emphasizing the significance of hygiene within the premises. The proprietor, a friendly woman with a no-nonsense demeanor, manages the business alongside another staff member, presumably a family member. Despite its diminutive size, the eatery offers an enjoyable dining experience at reasonable prices, making it an excellent choice for a cozy evening in, perhaps accompanied by a cinematic experience. My personal preference gravitates towards their delectable Mango Sticky Rice, which generously proportions sticky rice, surpassing the quantity offered at other establishments I have visited. In summary, this unpretentious venue exudes charm, providing superb nourishment at affordable costs, earning my wholehearted endorsement.

We indulged in a prolonged sojourn at this esteemed lodging establishment subsequent to securing an advantageous arrangement through Priceline for a mere $90 per night. Frankly, had we been obligated to compensate the full tariff, I might have experienced a modicum of discontentment owing to the somewhat diminutive proportions of our accommodations. Nevertheless, the space was well-appointed and offered an impressive panorama of Heinz Field, which served as a pleasant diversion. Moreover, the site itself was remarkably convenient, permitting us to traverse the city on foot with minimal effort, an aspect that I invariably find appealing while exploring an unfamiliar metropolis. 

The inn itself boasted an air of opulence, particularly within its grand lobby. The proprietors had successfully preserved the inherent charm of the original decor while judiciously incorporating contemporary touches. Regrettably, the on-site dining venue did not quite live up to expectations. As is often the case with hotel restaurants, the prices were exorbitant, and the morning repast we partook of there was forgettable, to put it mildly.

A healthy choice for lunch or dinner in the plaza! The dumplings are homemade and are very soft. I had the carrot + beef dumplings and they were quite delicious. The congee is fairly cheap at 2$ a bowl so whenever I have spare change, I stop by and grab one. Give the place a try!

"It's Cirque du Soleil, ergo, one can infer that the production will be of exceptional quality. Notwithstanding, a certain vagueness permeates the narrative, but, admittedly, the visually stunning sets, costumes, and choreography more than compensate for this minor shortcoming. Following a few alcoholic beverages, an epiphany struck - the plot of K bears a striking resemblance to the iconic space opera, Star Wars. By keeping this parallel in mind, the narrative's coherence becomes self-evident; the struggle between Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and their adversaries, Darth Vader and the Emperor, serves as a facile analogy."

"Established by the visionary founder of the renowned Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe embodies an elevated, sophisticated ambiance reminiscent of a refined European bistro, offering an extensive array of delectable culinary creations accessible 24 hours a day to cater to the diverse needs of its clientele. In the aftermath of a vibrant nocturnal excursion, this esteemed eatery serves as an ideal setting for revitalizing one's senses and satisfying hunger pangs.

In the wee hours of the morning, our group of four friends, comprising Lucy Y., David G., Sarah A., and myself, converged upon this gastronomic haven seeking sustenance. Prior to our arrival, I had enthusiastically endorsed this venue, having personally experienced its gastronomic excellence on a previous occasion. As we approached the entrance, we chanced upon a group of inebriated individuals, partially clothed and loitering near the restroom facilities, engaging in boisterous merriment. Such scenes served as a testament to the establishment's commitment to accommodating the varied inclinations of its patrons.

Upon entering the restaurant, we were promptly seated and presented with menus brimming with enticing options. My craving for a hearty breakfast led me to order the Smoked Salmon, skillfully prepared with onions and scrambled eggs, accompanied by a side of crispy hash browns. This simple yet elegant dish harmoniously married the rich flavors of smoked salmon and eggs, yielding a satisfying culinary experience that satiated my appetite and prepared me for a restful slumber.

While the prices at Grand Lux Cafe may be slightly higher than those of other 24-hour establishments, the superior quality of both the cuisine and service rendered it a worthwhile investment. It is essential to note that the late-night menu is the only option available after a certain hour, catering to the diverse preferences of the cafe's clientele."

Swanky.

I think that is a good summary of Wynn Casino. I didn't stay here, but had a great time at their casino. If you signed up for their Red Card, you will get $10 FREE PLAY credit. We played our credit and had a couple of delicious Chocolate Martinis. 

We were tipsy at 1 pm and I won about $12 from the Mona Lisa slot machine. Thank you, Wynn. I kinda heart you from that point on. Hopefully next time, I can come by and visit again. It was fun.

"This exceptional gathering space in Edinburgh offers an optimal environment for hosting productive conferences and meetings. We reserved the 'Glass Room', a premier event space located at the pinnacle of the structure, boasting a secluded balcony that affords breathtaking panoramic vistas of the cityscape. \n\nThe Hub graciously provided us with a delectable midday repast, consisting of an assortment of delicious sandwiches, which were complemented by an indulgent, rich chocolate cake that served as the pice de rsistance of our culinary experience and fostered an even greater affection for the venue. Additionally, they thoughtfully placed Edinburgh rock on the tables, providing a delightful sugary treat to enjoy during moments of tedium or excessive bureaucracy, thereby ensuring a consistent level of enthusiasm and engagement throughout our gathering."

"The eatery exudes an inviting ambiance reminiscent of a cozy chalet, nestled conveniently on McGill Street, at the intersection of the business district and Old Montreal. Grange offers a seamless dining experience for those seeking a relaxed evening on the quays after work, boasting an uncomplicated yet diverse menu featuring tartares, generous salads, and mouthwatering burgers that cater to various palates. Prices are moderate to high, averaging around $25 per plate, but the restaurant compensates with an impressive wine selection. Although the service was friendly, it was somewhat sluggish, but we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will likely return."

I recently attended the October Adults Night Out. The premise of the program is great-free admission, adult beverages, etc. I enjoyed exploring the museum and it was a nice activity for a Friday Night. The only downfall(s) were 1. The line to check in was extremely long. It didn't move slow, but it wasn't fast either. I had registered online but forgot to print the tickets. I would suggest definitely printing tickets ahead of time. The second issue was the \"beer garden.\" While I enjoyed the premise and the beers, there were only 2 beer servers and 1 wine server for many many people. The line went painfully slow and it made it hard to use the drink tickets and visit the center. Many people were actually giving away their tickets because the line was too long. I would attend another ANO again but I hope that they make some changes in the future to the above mentioned things.

Radio Maria has become our sanctuary, a place where my companions and I can indulge in delectable victuals and savor an atmosphere that fosters conviviality. We endeavor to partake in a 'girl's night out' on a monthly basis, and this eatery never fails to satiate our craving for a tranquil dining experience replete with captivating conversation pieces and exceptional service. Indeed, it ranks among my most beloved locales in Champaign for enjoying a leisurely meal.
Ordered for delivery here because I was at the TownePlace Suites nearby.  Lots of food and the sushi was awesome.  Delivered in less than 30 min on a sat night.
The modified text should not exceed 512 tokens.

"Rose macarons, a culinary delight that has captured the hearts of gastronomes worldwide, serve as a paradigmatic example of the unwavering commitment to excellence and attention to detail that this establishment embodies in its entirety, extending beyond the realm of delectable pastries to encompass an array of tantalizing desserts that cater to diverse tastes and preferences, with the exception of crepes, which, despite their versatility, fail to meet the lofty standards set by the remainder of the menu; indeed, this eatery represents the quintessence of what any enterprise or individual should strive to become: fastidious, polished, aesthetically pleasing, spotless, and utterly breathtaking."

Big sandwiches.  Big.

Bread is great on a good day and fair when they don't have it fresh.

Mom loves the Philly cheese-steak.

I like the Italian.  I always ask for hot peppers.

Ordering and paying can be a bit confusing.  Best thing to do is to order and immediately go to the cash register to pay.  Otherwise you have your sandwich, you're hungry and then you have to go pay.  I'm not sure how they don"t get ripped off.  It would seem to me it would be easy to order, wait, take and leave. 

The chips they offer, name escaping me now, are very good.  I know that at most sandwich places I do not get chips but here I do.  BBQ is my favorite here.

While not as spacious as Palazzo/Venetian, they do have nice rooms which comparable to Cosmo and the others. It may be the same size or even bigger. 

The difference between Signature and the others is there's a stove and microwave which means you can reheat some leftovers or cook some snacks. It comes in handy.

The only negative about Signature is it's off strip. I mean, really off strip. The only way to get on strip is to take a long walk through a tunnel which leads to MGM. It's not that bad but MGM is on one end of the strip and when you want to hit up Encore, it's definitely taxi time. Also, there is no casino in here.

The parking is a little wonky too. You need to be a guest to park here and there's no self-parking, it's all valet.

Besides those little details, it's a nice place to stay. Quiet, but nice.

I love it here.  Everyone is happy and friendly. The pool was nice and relaxing. I ate at 5 different places.  Yummy at all 5. Love walking around the forum shops. It's just a happy place.  The cons of this place is the smell of smoke.  It seemed really strong. I had my kids with me. They had a blast.

"Flavors of India presents an adequate luncheon buffet, albeit with inconsistent quality on different days. Despite my occasional patronage, I yearn for a broader culinary spectrum. Notwithstanding, the rational pricing and hospitable service have coaxed me into a four-star assessment, pending further exploration."

If you seek authentic Italian cuisine within the Chandler/Tempe vicinity, this establishment is an optimal choice.  Operated by a genuine Italian family from New York, the atmosphere exudes a warm, welcoming ambiance upon entry, enhanced by the tasteful dcor and cordial interaction between the proprietors and patrons.  The service was prompt, efficient, and hospitable.  Our culinary excursion commenced with a delectable Caesar salad, boasting an impressive flavor profile.  My spouse opted for the linguine accompanied by a succulent red clam sauce, featuring copious amounts of garlic and clams, rendering it utterly savory.  I relished the baked ziti, an enormous serving brimming with rich, velvety sauce and generous portions of melted mozzarella cheese, resulting in an unforgettable epicurean experience.  Even my fastidious young daughter thoroughly enjoyed the fare, signaling a resounding success.  We concluded our meal with the heavenly cannoli dessert, providing a sublime finale to a meal already teeming with gastronomic delights.  Prices at this eatery are eminently reasonable, particularly considering the exceptional quality of the Italian cuisine served.  Furthermore, the utilization of coupons and remarkable takeout discounts transforms the dining experience into an unmitigated triumph.

"I have had the pleasure of procuring confectionaries from this establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say, they have consistently met and surpassed my expectations in terms of taste and quality. The frosting, in particular, has a delightful creaminess that is not overpowered by an excessive amount of sugar, which makes for a refreshing change of pace from the typical saccharine-laden birthday cake. Furthermore, the Asian-inspired flavors, such as green tea and sweet potato, while potentially unfamiliar to some, are truly exceptional and showcase the bakery's dedication to innovation and diversity. My only suggestion, and I implore the management to consider this, would be the implementation of a more modern payment system, such as Square or similar platforms, in order to alleviate the inconvenience and limitations associated with cash transactions, especially given the premium pricing of their products. This adjustment would not only enhance the overall customer experience but also align the bakery with contemporary standards adopted by other local businesses, such as East End Brewery and Commonplace Coffee."

Awaiting our arrival was a suave and attentive server, who presented us with an array of delectable beverages, including their signature mango mojitos, which we found to be utterly refreshing and tantalizing to the palate. Furthermore, the eatery offered a diverse selection of mouth-watering appetizers, one of which, a savory pan bread, left us in a state of gastronomic euphoria. It would be remiss of us not to mention the enticing entrees that followed, each dish expertly prepared and artfully presented. Despite its unassuming location within the confines of a strip mall, the proprietor has managed to create a warm and inviting ambiance, replete with stylish furnishings and appointments, thereby establishing an atmosphere conducive to an exceptional dining experience.

It's admirable to see a record shop avoid the mainstream. Underground  Solu'shn prides itself on offering those hidden rarities, hard to find gems and an impressive selection of vinyl.  Ultimately this comes at a price with the average vinyl/ CD costing 12-14 pounds.  Nonetheless, unlike the larger entertainment mega-stores, you can try out your chosen record on any of the available decks: a sort of 'try before you buy' system. If your a budding DJ and your looking to boost your track collection with some rare gems, chances are Solu'shn will stock such items.

"I have an inclination to reference this location as 'The Key Shack,' due to its unpretentious appearance, which belies its efficacy in providing a diverse array of key-related services. Situated within the Park Road Shopping Center, this modest abode may appear somewhat questionable upon initial inspection, particularly when juxtaposed with the surrounding establishments; however, do not allow its humble visage to mislead you, for the proprietors possess the proficiency and expertise necessary to accomplish their tasks with expediency and precision. \n\nMy acquaintance with this establishment arose via a personal recommendation from a colleague, who extolled the virtues of their proficiency in duplicating obscure keys. In quest of a rare key for one of the upscale residential structures in the vicinity, I elected to pay a visit to this venue. Following a brief interval of approximately five minutes, during which time I engaged in financial transactions and acquired a novel key, I departed the premises feeling thoroughly satisfied with the quality of service I had received. Thus, if you are confronted with the challenge of replicating an uncommon key, I would unequivocally endorse this location as your optimal destination. Furthermore, upon completion of your business at 'The Key Shack,' you may choose to perambulate through the remainder of the shopping center, whereupon you will encounter an assortment of enticing establishments, including purveyors of delectable cupcakes, coffeehouses, craft stores, and antique emporiums."

I tried out Isis Salon about a month ago.  After reading the reviews on Isis, I decided to give it a try! Kelly was great! She was nice and listened to what I wanted. I loved the way my hair turned out! I got a haircut and partial highlights for $85 (half of what I normally spend!). Awesome price! I've gone to expensive salons before and just got an okay service....now that I've found Isis, I will definitely be coming back!

I am not inclined to indulge in uncritical enthusiasm for this establishment at present. Securing a reservation on a Sunday proved to be a straightforward process, which suggests that the restaurant's popularity may not be as pronounced as some reviews would suggest. The cost of dining here is reasonable, and our server provided attentive and responsive service throughout the meal. My dinner companion and I opted to sample the steak bernaise, which featured a citrusy butter sauce that unexpectedly delighted my taste buds. However, the sirloin itself was somewhat chewy in texture, although its thinness made it manageable when cut into smaller pieces. Notably, the portion size of the accompanying fries was quite generous. While the quality of the meal was satisfactory for the price, I remain skeptical about the accuracy of the restaurant's four-star rating, as assigned by an excess of two thousand Yelp reviewers. The dessert offerings were underwhelming, with the apple tartin in particular failing to meet our expectations. Rather than featuring fan-shaped apple slices, the dish consisted of a single large slice of apple baked beneath a layer of puff pastry. Overall, I would rate the culinary aspects of our meal as three stars, with the positive service experience contributing an additional star.

We visited Butters at approximately 11 am on a Saturday, and encountered a brief delay of roughly thirty minutes before being seated, which underscored the establishment's popularity among patrons. Upon being seated, our server promptly attended to our needs, acquiring our beverage preferences and expeditiously delivering a carafe of ice water to our table, alongside a steaming hot cup of coffee and a refreshing glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The culinary offerings we sampled, specifically an omelet complemented by hash browns and pancakes, were indeed quite satisfying, and our server's attentiveness and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience were commendable, particularly given the high volume of clientele present at the time. It is worth noting that the demographic composition of the restaurant's patronage skewed towards middle-aged women, some of whom sported conspicuously augmented physical attributes, but this did not detract from the overall enjoyment of our repast. In conclusion, Butters emerges as a highly recommended venue for a satisfying breakfast, provided one is willing to tolerate a brief waiting period.

I have seen every single performer who has fronted this show, from really good to really bad but last night with Coco was the BEST.

Mel B. & ??? was awesome way back in the day when the show opened (but what do you expect with people who can SING & DANCE??).

Holly Madison was absolutely horrible. Might as well have taped a spot on the stage for her to stand because she had no idea what was going on. Sister looked like she was lost!

Angel Porrino! What a DOLL, way better (as in more enthusiastic about the 8 minutes on stage) than Holly was and way better to look at too. I hope we continue to see her around Vegas for awhile.

CoCo last night owned it! Thank god they put someone in the show again who could dance. Shake that big booty girl!!! I hope eventually they change more of the show (they changed it a little between Holly & Coco) so we have more Coco dancing.

"Indulged in a tardy midday repast.  The guacamole was delectable, as was the innovative sangria-infused margarita that I had the pleasure of consuming (alas, the moniker assigned to this potent potable escapes me at present).

Opted for a torta, and the meat was expertly marinated, boasting a subtle sweetness that did not overpower the palate.  The portion size was generous, bordering on excessive.  The fish tacos, too, were quite satisfactory, with each bite bursting with flavor.

Regrettably, the service proved subpar, leaving much to be desired.  My OpenTable reservation was not properly recorded, prompting an inquiry from the platform subsequent to my visit, querying the reason behind my non-attendance at the appointed hour.  Although the matter ultimately reached a successful resolution, such an occurrence ought to have been avoided initially."

"Culinary delights are utterly superb, complemented by exceptional customer service; boasting an expansive establishment, this eatery rarely necessitates a wait, making it an ideal venue for families to enjoy a delectable dining experience; it is highly recommended that you partake in the gastronomical indulgence."
We went to Edinburgh Castle early on a Sunday morning trying to beat the crowds and it definitely worked.  The castle is very well preserved and a must see attraction while in Edinburgh.

We indulged in an evening excursion on a Sunday, merely for the purpose of partaking in a culinary experience and strolling around the picturesque lake and quaint village, presuming that the late afternoon and early evening hours would yield a moderate influx of patrons. However, our expectations were drastically disproven, as the area was eerily desolate. We parked our vehicle in the Village parking garage and observed only a few other cars, fostering an unsettling atmosphere akin to a post-apocalyptic landscape. As we traversed the passage leading to the lower village shopping district, an unnerving sense of emptiness enveloped us, rendering the ambiance almost surreal. Our trek through the primary shopping area resembled a journey through a desolate wasteland, devoid of any signs of life, prompting us to ponder whether we had unwittingly entered a realm inhabited by the undead. We opted to dine at the Black Pepper Grill, whereupon inquiring about their operating hours, we were greeted by a lone staff member who assured us of their availability. We settled into a table within a sparsely populated restaurant, wherein we constituted one of merely two groups present during this ostensibly peak dining period. Notwithstanding the exceptional quality of both the cuisine and service, the absence of patrons engendered an unshakable feeling of unease. Subsequently, we ventured towards the recently established Ravella, whereupon entering, we encountered a warm and welcoming ambiance. The front bar boasted unexpectedly reasonable prices, yet its patronage was sparse, mirroring the pervasive desolation that characterized our entire excursion. I sincerely hope that Lake Las Vegas experiences a revival, given its abundant potential; until such a time, I shall document my haunting experience in a hypothetical episode of "Life After People," set against the backdrop of this once-thriving resort.

"This shopping center constitutes one of my preferred destinations for retail therapy, owing to its diverse array of enjoyable stores, dining establishments, and recreational pursuits. Notwithstanding, I have deducted a star from my rating due to the fact that navigating this mall during the peak summer season can be somewhat arduous, as certain prominent department stores and retailers are situated at a considerable distance from the primary structure, thereby necessitating multiple trips by automobile and subsequent re-parking endeavors to access all of one's favored retail outlets. In essence, while not perfect, this mall remains an excellent venue for indulging in some retail therapy."

"I have an immense fondness for occupying a seat at the bar, as it provides me with a truly delightful and satisfying encounter. The culinary offerings were utterly delectable, and their presentation was flawlessly executed, allowing me to thoroughly appreciate the proficiency and expertise that was invested in each dish, despite the fact that I did not wholeheartedly enjoy every single item on the menu. Notwithstanding its high prices, this establishment is undoubtedly worthy of a visit, making it an excellent choice for a special occasion or a night out with friends."

"Boasts an array of seating options at the forefront of the establishment, thereby facilitating social interactions amidst the sweltering heat of the summer season. The staff members exhibit remarkable cordiality, especially during the wee hours of the day when I tend to procure a beverage. Anticipate a moderate level of patronage due to its strategic placement."

Visited some acquaintances residing at this off-strip hotel and indulged in a delectable breakfast. Our attentive server assisted us in making informed decisions regarding the menu and elucidated the substantial proportions. They are remarkably voluminous, compelling us to sample a few of their critically acclaimed dishes. We relished Sage Fried Chicken Benedict (comprising spinach, hardwood bacon, tomato & mozzarella, chipotle cream, scrambled eggs), and Griddled French Toast (ooey gooey delightfulness). Wow...talk about enormity! Our server graciously cautioned us about the generous serving sizes and offered to provide us with takeout containers, considerately allowing my companion to transport a portion to his hotel roommate. Since we only consumed half of each dish, it proved satisfactory. Although I cannot comment on the lunch or dinner offerings, their breakfast menu, highly commended by the concierge, left us thoroughly satiated and content. The sole drawback, stemming from my accommodations at the Strip, was the inconvenient drive. In the future, I shall venture to the establishment situated on West Sahara or Imperial Palace.

First time I ventured into the establishment, I requested a slice of their culinary masterpiece known as pizza, and subsequently, I was overcome with a sensation that they would need to prepare an entirely novel pie for my consumption. I was mildly irritated that no one saw fit to inform me of this minor detail. It seemed to me that this would be a fundamental aspect of communication. Thus, after inquiring and becoming cognizant of this fact, I opted to depart due to temporal constraints. However, I did not dismiss them altogether, as I was inclined to give them another opportunity to demonstrate their culinary prowess.

Upon placing an order this evening, I acquired an 18-inch pizza for the sum of $9.95 and, upon verifying the contents of my refrigerator, I discovered that I had indeed ordered a half dozen chicken wings, unbeknownst to me, until now. This revelation served to elucidate the reason behind the total cost of $20. Furthermore, I must commend the kitchen staff on their proficiency in preparing delectable poultry appendages, as they truly excelled in their execution. As a self-proclaimed authority on chicken wings, I have sampled a plethora of establishments throughout British Columbia, Canada, and I must say that only one restaurant has managed to challenge my gastronomical abilities, leaving me unable to complete all 12 specimens. The culinary artists at this particular venue have mastered the art of creating piquant yet savory wings, which they affectionately refer to as "911." While they may not be scorchingly hot, I have no doubt that their lingering effects will become apparent at some point tomorrow. In my opinion, this is the ultimate litmus test for assessing the quality of chicken wings, and I am pleased to report that this establishment has passed with flying colors.
Super cute spot with the freshest of the fresh ingredients. Tasty sandwiches and salads. Fast and friendly service. Adorable country farm feel. What's not to love?

"This culinary establishment boasts an impressive array of delectable barbecue offerings, which, unfortunately, were slightly marred by the fact that the poultry component of our meal was somewhat desiccated. Additionally, we noted a few minor shortcomings in terms of the tidiness of the interior, specifically pertaining to a certain sign adjacent to the fountain beverage dispenser advising against the disposal of unwanted items down the drain, as well as the unorthodox placement of waste receptacles. Despite these relatively insignificant drawbacks, our experience at this eatery was generally satisfying, albeit not quite sufficient enough to warrant a perfect rating of five."

The delectable and savory Chicago Vienna Beef hot dog, lavishly adorned with an assortment of fresh condiments and toppings, is available at a remarkably affordable price of $4, accompanied by a portion of handcrafted, crispy french fries that have been meticulously prepared from scratch. This unparalleled culinary offering represents the most advantageous value in town, and we extend our sincerest gratitude for your attention to this enticing proposition. The Bike Chaplain extends his cordial regards.

This culinary establishment exudes an ambiance that is reminiscent of a refined dining experience, in contrast to the utilitarian nature of a fast-food restaurant, and offers a reasonable price point of $30 for an all-you-can-consume buffet, with the option to upgrade to unlimited beverages, including mimosas, bloody Marys, and champagne, for an additional $37. During the brunch period, which spans from 8 am to 3 pm, the venue boasts an extensive selection of delectable items, ranging from light and fluffy pancakes to succulent kalbi Korean short ribs, catering to a diverse array of palates. Patrons have the liberty to either craft their own personalized omelette, courtesy of a skilled chef, or indulge in a variety of seafood, Asian-inspired dishes, fresh fruits and vegetables, pasta, eggs benedict, and even sushi, via a self-service format. For those who possess a sweet tooth, the dessert section is a must-visit, featuring an assortment of mouthwatering gelato, accompanied by a medley of vibrant, bite-sized pastries, such as rich chocolate mousse atop tangy passion fruit, diminutive gold-flecked wafer cones, and chocolate-covered strawberries. Unlike traditional buffets, where portion control often poses a challenge, this establishment offers pre-portioned servings in miniature cups, bowls, and dishes, allowing patrons to sample a variety of flavors without worrying about overindulging. Although the wait time may be somewhat prolonged, the unique system in place, involving both a cashier line and a separate queue for entry into the buffet area, helps to streamline the process and minimize inconvenience for eager diners.

"While I do not customarily partake in a substantial morning repast, there are occasional instances in which I arrive at the workplace and recognize that failing to consume sustenance in a timely manner will result in an abrupt decline in my energy levels and productivity. This particular morning happened to be one such occasion, compelling me to venture forth to The Silver Spoon in quest of their delectable corned beef hash special. Unfortunately, it was not featured on that day's menu, prompting me to seek recommendations from Jono, who suggested the breakfast bagel sandwich as a suitable alternative. Given that an 'everything' bagel was available, I opted for that specific variety, pairing it with bacon as my protein of choice. Upon consuming this satisfying culinary creation, I felt compelled to momentarily suspend my engagement in discussions pertaining to financial matters in order to savor its flavors thoroughly."

Party Mania is my first and only port of call when I am looking for a fancy dress outfit. Whatever the dressing up occasion, Party Mania will almost certainly be able to fulfil your needs. 

Party Mania sells a wide selection of different fancy dress outfits in packets which are handy, such as superwoman and an 80's disco outfit. They also sell a range of accessories to complete the perfect outfit, such as wigs, witch's fingernails, hats, masks and gloves. Party Mania also sell outfits for Hen Nights such as L-plates and garters. 

In the run up to Halloween, Party Mania is always absolutely packed with people looking for the perfect costumes. They also sell make up, ribbons and feathers, which I have bought several of to complete my fancy dress outfit. The shop is situated just around the corner from the main University campus, George Square, so it is a handy place for students to go to for a costume. 

Balloons, banners and themed decorations are also available in this store. Party Mania stocks everything you could every want for the perfect fancy dress outfit, although it is a wee bit pricey.

"Ideal emporium for distinctive, ingenious, and amusing greeting cards, exquisite writing materials, stunning paper products, and an array of novelty items and presents. My gratitude extends to the sales personnel who exhibit unwavering kindness and politeness. Although parking may present a challenge, once you secure a space, you will undoubtedly experience immense pleasure while perusing the abundance of merchandise within the establishment."

So I just cancelled my membership after 6 years or so, no hassle there which was good. Got a refund for the remaining time. \nIt is a nice place, but I started taking yoga, privately, so no need for the gym for now.

We recently opted to avail ourselves of the accommodations offered by this establishment, as we had chosen to formalize our nuptials at the renowned Caesars Palace. Upon our arrival, we were assigned lodgings in the Augustus Tower, designated as a "deluxe room."
